Tejashwi Yadav.description: PATNA/ BHAGALPUR: RJD chief Lalu Prasad’s younger son and leader of opposition in Bihar legislative assembly Tejashwi Prasad Yadav kicked off the Lok Sabha election campaign on Monday by addressing public meetings at Gaya, Banka and Bhagalpur in support of the Mahagathbandhan candidates. Close aides of Tejashwi said he is expected to address around 200 election meetings across the state over the next two months. “Tejashwi is the face of RJD and the star campaigner of Mahagathbandhan. He will be canvassing for candidates of all the Mahagathbandhan constituents — RJD, Congress, RLSP, HAM(S) and VIP. Thus, he will be addressing three to four election meetings every day,” Tejashwi’s political adviser Sanjay Yadav told TOI on Monday. Canvassing for RJD candidate Shailesh Kumar alias Bulo Mandal from Bhagalpur, Tejashwi came down heavily on NDA governments at the Centre and in state. He accused PM Narendra Modi of making false promises and propaganda to win the 2014 general election. “It won’t be repeated in the ensuing Lok Sabha elections,” Tejashwi said while raising questions about employment scenario and issues of Vijay Malaya, Nirav Modi, Mehul Chowksi and others who fled the country after swindling money from banks in India. Criticizing Nitish for snapping ties with RJD in 2017, Tejashwi said there was acute shortage of fertilizers, while the health services were also in a poor state. He accused deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi of protecting those involved in the multi-crore Srijan scam in Bhagalpur and some other districts. Urging the audience to vote for the RJD candidate, Tejashwi said the Bhagalpur voters had showed a mirror to Modi by voting for RJD in 2014. “They should do the same this election as the NDA government stands exposed,” he said. Political observers feel Tejashwi has become a good orator, especially after coming out of power in July 2017 when CM Nitish Kumar snapped ties with RJD-led Mahagathbandhan and rejoined BJP-led NDA. “Though not as good as his father in terms of having a rustic touch, Tejashwi is a good orator in terms of eloquence,” said DM Diwakar, political observer and professor at AN Sinha Institute of Social Studies. 2 Puducherry students bag gold medal in.description: PUDUCHERRY: Two students from Puducherry claimed international ranks and bagged gold medals in the contest organized by Science Olympiad Foundation (SOF) for the year 2018-19. A Class VII student from Brainy Blooms L’ Ecole Internationale School (CBSE) M Thishaanth claimed the first rank in the international general knowledge Olympiad and bagged the gold medal. A Class II student from BlueStar Higher Secondary School T Hari Haran finished first in the International Mathematics Olympiad and bagged the gold medal. The two students were also awarded a cash prize of Rs 50,000 each. More than 50 lakh students from over 50,000 schools across 1,400 cities and 30 countries participated in the contest during 2018-19. More than 30,000 students from Puducherry participated in the contest. SOF felicitated the medallists in a simple function at New Delhi. The former chief justice of India justice Dipak Misra felicitated the medallist in the presence of SOF founder and executive director Mahabir Singh. In addition to international winners, the foundation also honoured close to 61,000 students from 6,300 schools for achieving top state-level ranks and more than eight lakh students for achieving top ranks in their respective schools. The foundation also honoured more than 2,000 principals and teachers for their commitment to academics and single-minded pursuit in successfully improving students’ academic knowledge. Three children drown in lake.description: CUDDALORE: Three children who went to take bath in a lake near Bhuvanagiri in Cuddalore district drowned on Tuesday. Police said M Baranidaran, 9 his twin brother M Daranidaran and his neighbour and school mate B Poovarasan, 9, a Class 3 student of a government primary school in Bhuvanigiri were returning home from school, which reopened on Tuesday.  When they crossed Sathapadi Lake, they decided to bath in the waterbody. They deposited their school bags and uniforms on the bund of the lake and got into the lake. The three boys, who cannot swim, unknowingly reached a deep part of the lake and drowned. Their parents launched a hunt for them as they did not reach home after school hours. Their parents found their uniforms and school bags on the bund of the lake. They alerted the fire and rescue services personnel, who with the help of the local villagers recovered the bodies of the three children. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Mahagathbandhan.description: NEW DELHI: Taking a swipe at the grand alliance of opposition parties, finance minister Arun Jaitley on Friday said the 'mahagathbandhan' is a 'non-bandhan', political circus and a recipe for chaos. Several political parties, mostly traditional BJP opponents, have come together to take on the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) in the ensuing general elections beginning April 11. In a blog post, Jaitley said that over the last several months, India was "exhausted" with the talk of a 'Mahagathbandhan'. The rationale, he said, was that Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the BJP were very strong and could not be challenged by individual party. Stressing that Indians judge politicians by their merit and capacity and no longer by any traditional loyalty, he said: "We were promised a 'coalition of rivals' because India had to be saved. We were promised a common minimum agenda. Each leader amongst the aspirant Prime Ministers wanted to become a 'sutradhar' (anchor) of the alliance. He/she would periodically organise shows in his/her State and invite the entire bandwagon." In opposition camp, Jaitley said there is a tussle for leadership as already multiple candidates have made their desire clear to take over the mantle of the leadership. According to him, each one of them is interested to see the strength of the other party's contender depleting and also have high hopes in a chaotic and highly hung Parliament. "He/ she believes that only in a chaotic situation he/she has a chance," said Jaitley, who is heading the BJP's publicity division of the seven-phase Lok Sabha elections. The past track record of such governments in terms of policy, longevity and growth has to be borne in mind, he said adding their track record of corruption is equally well-known. Jaitley further said it is only because of the size of the BJP and clarity on leadership in the last coalition that a successful government was run under Prime Minister Modi. "Today you have no 'gathbandhan' let alone 'mahagathbandhan'. It is a 'non-bandhan'. You have no leader, no programme, no meeting of minds. "Stability, which is paramount, is a major casualty. The only thing in common is negative agenda 'remove one man'. It is a recipe for chaos," he said in the blog titled 'A Political Circus Called 'Mahagathbandhan'. The nominations for the first two phases of polling are over and those for the third phase are about to happen. The results will be announced on May 23. JP Nadda.description: NEW DELHI: Ending speculation over the appointment of a working president, the BJP parliamentary board on Monday appointed former health minister and senior leader Jagat Prakash Nadda to the post even as home minister Amit Shah will continue to be party president. Nadda's appointment as working president was on the cards after he was not inducted into the government. Since Shah will need to meet his ministerial commitments, Nadda, as a full time party functionary, is expected to help him with the nitty-gritty of organisational tasks. "I am confident that under the leadership of Amit Shah and JP Nadda, and powered by the hard work of our karyakartas (workers), BJP will continue winning people's trust and serving our society. We remain committed to building a strong, developed and inclusive India," PM Modi tweeted. I am confident that under the leadership of Shri @AmitShah and Shri @JPNadda, and powered by the hardwork of our Ka… https://t.co/EyDidISB2W— Narendra Modi (@narendramodi) 1560786282000Modi said Nadda is a diligent worker who has risen through the ranks due to his hard work and organisational skills. "Humble and affable, he is widely respected across the BJP family. Congratulations to him on becoming the working president of the party," the Prime Minister added. Announcing the decision, defence minister Rajnath Singh said, "BJP won several elections under leadership of Amit Shah. But since PM appointed him home minister, Amit Shah himself said the responsibility of party president should be given to someone else. BJP Parliamentary board has selected JP Nadda as working president." Modi and other parliamentary board members including Shah, Rajnath Singh, Union ministers Nitin Gadkari, Thawar Chand Gehlot and senior BJP leaders Sushma Swaraj, Shivraj Singh Chauhan and Ramlal greeted Nadda after his selection as party working president. Hailing from Himachal, Nadda (58) has held several organisational posts at the national and state level. This will be the first time the party has appointed a working president. After considerable discussion it was decided that Shah's continuance would be required in view of important state elections coming up and the party also announced a membership drive and organisational elections that will keep cadre busy for several months. Singh said Nadda will remain the working president till BJP's membership drive and organisational elections are over. Process of the organisational elections has already begun as state unit elections are likely next month. As per procedure, it takes four-five months to complete the entire organisational elections. Singh said the parliamentary board wanted that Shah should look after the party as president until organisational elections of the party are completed. "However, Amit Shah himself urged that as home minister, he can't do justice with responsibilities as party chief and wanted someone to take over after which the parliamentary board unanimously selected Nadda as working president," Singh said. Nadda was mentioned as a likely party chief in 2014 when Rajnath Singh resigned after joining the Union ministry. However, Shah took over as party president. Nadda has long experience of the party organisation as he was the in-charge of the party headquarters and is a popular figure. Satta Matka 2018.description: AGRA: Shyam Vohra, known as 'satta king' of the Taj city, was denied bail by district court of Agra. Vohra, who was arrested by the Agra police in July for his alleged involvement in betting on FIFA World Cup matches. Earlier, in April, Vohra was arrested by the Nodia STF from Greater Noida for placing bets on IPL matches, but he was granted bail. After Vohra’s arrest, Agra police booked him and his known associates including his son Vatsal, wife Rakhi, nephew Prateek, brother-in-law Kaushal and others for their alleged involvement in betting. On Monday, judge Anil Kumar Pundhir rejected Vohra’s bail plea, who was charged for attempt to murder, as he allegedly opened fire on policemen. Further, Vohra was charged for running illegal gambling racket, criminal conspiracy and obstructing policemen from executing their duties. Police are yet to arrest the relatives and associates of Vohra. Several years back, Vohra had gain notoriety for betting on cricket matches. In April, during IPL matches, the gambling racket run by Vohra had deposited Rs 62 lakh in 10 banks, after which police approached banks to freeze the amount. Even during the FIFA World Cup, Vohra collected huge amount of cash through betting. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Doctors strike.description: KOLKATA: Junior doctors in Bengal finally called off their week-long strike and promised to resume duty on Tuesday morning, ending a stir that crippled out patient departments (OPDs) and severely hit emergency services at hospitals across the state. At a meeting held at state secretariat Nabanna on Monday evening, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee told a team of 31 junior doctors, " Lakkhi chhele, ebar tomra strike tule nao (Please withdraw your strike like good boys)", which they agreed to. The "cordial" negotiations between the CM and doctors were broadcast live for about 100 minutes by two regional channels. The doctors, who had adopted a strident posture against the administration for the initial police inaction against the kin of a bereaved patient at NRS Hospital last Monday (incident that triggered the stir) relented in the face of genuine-sounding assurances from the CM. The state administration medical fraternity face-off escalated after Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee issued a stern warning of action against the strike during her visit to SSKM Hospital last Thursday. What could have also played on their minds was the rising public opinion against the continuing strike, especially after the CM's appeal for talks last weekend. The striking doctors returned to the NRS campus on Monday and, after another general-body meeting, made a statement: "We hereby announce the withdrawal of the strike by junior doctors." Several issues were discussed at the meeting. They ranged from security measures - collapsible gates for emergency wards, regulated entry for patients' kin and enhanced police presence on medical campuses with nodal officers responsible for law and order - to the CM's suggestion for third-party PR professionals, who could act as grief counsellors and handle communication between "overworked doctors" and "aggrieved patients' kin" and grievance cells for patients. "We are delighted with the cordial manner in which the meeting was held, the CM's caring touch and concrete suggestions and assurances to the issues raised by us," one of the junior doctors said. "They (doctors) have genuine demands. We have listened to them and taken decisions to resolve them. This must be a continuous process. We have to see to it that such untoward incidents are averted and action is taken if something happens," Mamata said. The CM's "gentleness", however, came with the message that she could not be bullied. Urged by the junior doctors to visit the doctor who was injured in the NRS attack, and come to the NRS campus, she said, "Leave certain things to us...Give me your word that you will resume duty." In Video:CM Mamata accepts proposal of doctors to set up Grievance Redressal CellDownload The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Yogi Adityanath.description: VARANASI: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath slammed Congress president Rahul Gandhi for suddenly showing concern for the poor and asked why he didn’t ensure a minimum income scheme for them during Congress-led UPA regime when his mother Sonia Gandhi acted as ‘super prime minister’ and had a say in everything. Targeting Congress announcement of minimum income scheme for poor on coming to power, Yogi said, “Congress led UPA was in power in Centre from 2004 to 2014. Everybody knows how Rahul and his mother (Sonia Gandhi) were influential in UPA regime. However, in UPA’s 10-year regime Congress never showed the kind of sympathy for poor, unemployed, farmers and women of country like it is showing now for Pakistan.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Shiv Sena List 2019.description: MUMBAI: Shiv Sena has come up with it's first list of 21 candidates, out of 23 to contest in Lok Sabha polls in Maharashtra. Except Osmanabad, 17 sitting Sena MP's are part of the list, includes Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Raigad. Following complaints received by local functionaries from Osmanabad, the party has denied ticket to sitting MP Ravindra Gaikwad. Gaikwad, who had allegedly hit an Air India staffer with his slipper because he was refused a business class seat in March 2017. Maharashtra: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageSena has kept two seats, Palghar and Satara, on hold, likely to announce on Sunday. Late Chintaman Wanga, former BJP MP's son Shrinivas likely to contest from Palghar on Sena ticket whereas former NCP legislator Narendra Patil may might contest as Sena candidate from Satara. Patil met Shiv Sena president Uddhav Thackeray on Friday at Matoshree. Other candidates are: South Mumbai: Arvind Sawant; South Central Mumbai: Rahul Shewale; Mumbai North West: Gajanan Kirtikar; Kalyan: Shrikant Shinde; Raigad: union minister Anant Gite; Osmanabad: Omraje Nimbalkar, Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg: Vinayak Raut; Kolhapur-Sanjay Mandlik; Hatkanangle: Dhairyasheel Mane; Nashik: Hemant Godse; Shirdi: Sadashiv Lokhande; Shirur: Shivajirao Adhalrao Patil; Aurangabad: Chandrakant Khaire; Yavatmal Washim: Bhawana Gawli; Buldana: Prataprao Jadhav; Ramtek: Kripal Tumane; Amrawati-Anandrao Adsul, Parbhani: Sanjay Jadhav; Maval: Shrirang Barne; Hingoli: Hemant Patil. Heritage enthusiast unearths stone inscr.description: TIRUVANNAMALAI: Heritage enthusiasts here have unearthed a stone inscription, dating back to the 10th century AD, which describes the water management system during the Chola era. It details how Paranthaga Chola had commissioned digging of two lakes within a 711km radius at Siruvallur village near Kalasapakkam. The inscription was erected by a clan called Irumudi Chola Priyankaraiar in praise of the king. It was found in a banana grove close to the Siruvallur village lake. S Premkumar, a heritage enthusiast from Tiruvannamalai district, and Soundharya of Siruvallur, a final year student at the BA history department of Tiruvannamalai Government Arts College, found the stone inscription buried in the grove last week. After being informed, a team of archaeologists headed by R Sekar, former archaeology department professor at Madras University, conducted a detailed study of the inscription. Speaking to TOI, Sekar said the stone inscription was made by a clan named Irumudi Chola Pariyankariar in praise of king Paranthaga Chola for constructing two lakes at Siruvallur village. The stones inscription, which has 10 lines on the front and 12 lines on the opposite side, dates back to the 10th century AD, he said. The modern Siruvallur village was known as ‘Palakundrathu Kottathu Keezhvenattu Kanthalur Kuttrathil Sellur’ back then, according to the inscriptions. The inscription had also thanked a group of people called ‘Vanigargal Ainootravar’ for constructing the lake under the supervision of Madhalangkizhan Nambitaran of Singaranaatu Melvazhi village. Villagers and traders, who had donated lands to build the lakes, were also thanked. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Centac extends last date for courses.description: Puducherry: The Centralized admission committee (Centac) has extended the last date for online submission of application forms for admissions into undergraduate performing and fine arts courses for the academic year 2019-20 in Bharathiar Palkalaikoodam (BPK), a performing and fine arts college run by a government society, to June 10. The committee has set up helplines (0413 2655570-71) to assist the students in the online admission process. The helpline will function from 10am to 5pm on all working days. BPK offers four-year professional courses in three disciplines viz., visual arts (students will be allotted painting/ sculpture/applied art branches during the second year of their course of study), in music (students will be admitted into vocal/violin/veena/mridangam in accordance with their performance during the aptitude test) and in dance (Bharatanatyam). For more details and to apply online visit www.centacpuducherry.in.TNN Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Irula man seeks release of father abduct.description: TIRUVANNAMALAI: A 20-year-old Irula youth, who managed to escape along with his father from their workplace where the duo was allegedly harassed and ill-treated for more than a year, has sought the Tiruvannamalai district administration’s intervention to rescue his father who was again ‘abducted’ by a sugarcane contractor for money. The father and son, who had received an advance of Rs 27,000 a year ago and were confined as bonded labourers for sugarcane cutting work, were asked to return Rs 18,000 by the contractor to be released. Murugan, 45, an Irula daily wager, and his family, including wife Selvi, 40, and younger son Muniyappan, 20, who were living in their hometown Reddikuppam near Vandavasi, had due to poverty obtained the advance from Sakthivel, a broker, after assuring that they would work for a sugarcane contractor. Murugan and Muniyappan, who were confined along with six others by contractor Sundar Raman of Thattampalayam in districts including Tuticorin, Villupuram and Cuddalore, were not paid their wages. Muniyappan said, “The contractor would wake up at 5 am and make us work in the cane field from 6 am to 7 pm. We were forced to consume cheap brandy, so that we would forget the pain of working long hours. If we refuse to consume the liquor, we would be threatened with hard work subsequently. Though we worked for a year, the contractor said only Rs 9,000 of the advance had been paid off and we should work for two more years to settle the pending money. As we were new to sugarcane cutting work and feared that we may die due to the workload assigned by the contractor, on May 27, I and my father, who were confined at a workplace in Thoothukudi district, managed to escape and reached our hometown the next day. On May 29, contractor Sundar Raman who came to our village with his associates forcibly took away my father in the presence of other villagers. Sundar Raman demanded that we settle the pending Rs 18,000 to release him.” Though he had earlier lodged a complaint with local police and Vandavasi RDO, no action was taken to rescue his father, Muniyappan claimed. Meanwhile, he decided to lodge a petition at the Tiruvannamalai SP and Collector’s office. When TOI contacted collector K S Kandasamy and highlighted the issue, he assured that appropriate action would be taken to rescue Murugan and arrest Sundar Raman with the help of Thoothukudi revenue and police officials. BJP List 2019 Tamilnadu.description: CHENNAI: The BJP's Tamil Nadu candidates list announced on Thursday was on expected lines, with Union minister Pon Radhakrishnan being fielded from Kanyakumari, state chief Tamilisai Soundararajan in Tuticorin, national secretary H Raja in Sivaganga, C P Radhakrishnan in Coimbatore and vice-president Nainar Nagendran in Ramanathapuram. While Pon Radhakrishnan and Raja will fight Congress, which is yet to name candidates for its nine seats in DMK alliance, Tamilisai will cross swords with DMK heavyweight Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. H Raja to contest from Sivaganga for third timeH Raja is contesting from Sivaganga for the third time. In 2014, he came third with 1.33 lakh votes, while in 1999, he came second. It will be a keenly fought battle between Tamilisai and DMK’s state women wing secretary and Rajya Sabha MP K Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. Though Tamilisai initially preferred to contest from Chennai South, which has a sizeable votebank for the party, she finally settled for Tuticorin. AIADMK was keen on retaining south Chennai for sitting MP, J Jayavardhan, son of fisheries minister D Jayakumar. Former TN BJP chief Radhakrishnan will face CPM’s P R Natarajan in Coimbatore. This is the fifth time that Radhakrishnan has been fielded in Coimbatore, a BJP stronghold. While he won two consecutive Lok Sabha elections in 1998 and 1999, he was defeated in the 2004 and 2014 polls. Nainar Nagendran has been pitted against DMK’s IUML candidate K Nawaz Kani. While the party made a quick decision on candidates for four constituencies, Ramanathapuram delayed matters considering the keen contest for the seat among some senior leaders. Jaya Prada.description: HYDERABAD: It’s been a roller coaster ride for actress Jaya Prada in politics. The actress, who started off as a Telugu film heroine dominating the scene along with Sridevi some decades ago, changed her political course on Tuesday by joining the BJP. In the last 25 years of her political career, she has changed several parties. Hailing from Rajahmundry in Andhra Pradesh, she began her political career with the Telugu Desam Party in 1994 as she had done several films alongside TDP founderpresident N T Rama Rao. After N Chandrababu Naidu took over as chief minister, he nominated her to the Rajya Sabha and she served a term from 1996-2002. While in the TDP, Jaya Prada had a running feud with Renuka Chowdhary who was also in the TDP then. When it became clear that she was being ignored in the TDP, Jaya Prada looked for greener pastures elsewhere. The Samajwadi Party led by Mulayam Singh Yadav in Uttar Pradesh got Jaya Prada into its party fold. She contested the Rampur Lok Sabha seat from that state on the SP ticket and won in 2004. In the 2009 elections, she got re-elected from the same constituency. With differences sprouting between SP leader Amar Singh and Mulayam Singh Yadav, Jaya prada had to make a choice on who she would sail with. She preferred to join the new party that Amar Singh floated but that proved to be a futile exercise. Jaya Prada then joined the Rashtriya Janata Dal, led by Ajit Singh in UP, making the move along with Amar Singh. In the 2014 elections she was fielded as an LS candidate from Bijnor but lost. For some time, there was speculation that Jaya Prada would return to the Telugu Desam Party when she met Andhra Pradesh chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu in Amaravati in November 2015. It turned out that she had met Naidu only to invite him for her son Siddharth’s wedding that month in Hyderabad. In 2013, Jaya Prada had met Congress president Sonia Gandhi and that also led to speculation that she would join the Congress. She had even announced that she was interested in getting back to her home state and would continue her political career there. She was keen on returning to AP politics but nothing concrete materialised. On Tuesday, she was welcomed into the BJP at the party’s headquarters in Delhi. “I am working with a brave leader in whose hands India is safe,” she said about Modi. Deposit Rs 1 lakh to consider candidatur.description: PUDUCHERRY: The Centralized Admission Committee (Centac) has received a series of complaints from various quarters that the students, who were allotted MBBS seats in Jawaharlal Institute of Postgraduate Medical Education and Research (Jipmer), do not opt out of MBBS counselling conducted by Centac and unnecessarily block MBBS seats in Puducherry government and private medical colleges in the Union territory. The committee has come out with a solution to resolve this issue. It will get the list of students allotted seats in Jipmer and will not consider them for admission even if they are eligible. It will consider their candidature only if they deposit Rs 1 lakh as caution deposit.  The caution deposit will be forfeited if the candidate fails to join within the prescribed date. “If any candidate who has been selected in Jipmer wants his/her name to be considered, then the candidate has to deposit Rs 1lakh as the cautionary deposit. This cautionary deposit will be forfeited if the candidate is allotted a seat by Centac and fails to join within the prescribed date,” read the information brochure for admission into undergraduate professional courses for the academic year 2019-20. PM Modi.description: JEYPORE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said his government had taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' in space and asked people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions and not just raise slogans. Launching his campaign in eastern India with a rally in Jeypore area of Odisha's Koraput district, the prime minister said the NDA government wouldn't have been able to do any development work in the country without the support of the people. He sought blessings from his supporters for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections and asserted that the NDA government has left no stone unturned to bring about development in the state. Land, air or space, we had courage to do surgical strikes: PM Modi"The NDA government has been working hard to develop road and rail infrastructure in the state. There is no dearth of funds when it comes to development work in the country. "In the last five years, the government has been able to build homes for eight lakh families, light up 3,000 houses and provide gas connections to 40 lakh homes," Modi stated. Referring to Mission Shakti, when India demonstrated anti-satellite (ASAT) missile capability by shooting down a live satellite, he said the government has taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' (watchman) in space. He came down heavily on opposition parties who he said "belittled" the space achievement. "Those that are criticising the anti-satellite technology will be given a befitting reply in the elections," he claimed, urging people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions, not the one that only raises slogans. In Video:Govt has taken measures to set up 'chowkidar' in space: PM Narendra Modi in OdishaDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Ex-MP to PM: Create exclusive fisheries.description: PUDUCHERRY: Former Lok Sabha MP M Ramadass has urged Prime Minister Narendra Modi to create a separate ministry for fishery resources and fishermen welfare and appoint a separate minister with independent charge if not a cabinet minister. In a letter to the Prime Minister, the former MP said most of members of the fishing community remain backward and poor leading a hand-to-mouth existence. He said 69% of the 15 million fishermen in the country live below the poverty line and dwell in unsanitary conditions without basic amenities. The community is affected every year by storms or droughts or incessant rain. They remain at the lowest rung of the social ladder. He said their level of literacy remains low and social and economic status lower than that of SCs and STs in many parts of the country. Their political representation in the parliament and assemblies remain low. He pointed out that the Mandal Commission suggested reserving constituencies for fishermen community and accord tribal status to them. He said the marine production of the country is 25% less than its potential. The marine production potential was pegged at 3.92 million tonnes whereas the actual output stood at 2.92 million tonnes. “Lack of infrastructure, inability to venture into deep sea fishing, high cost of fishing, intermittent natural hazards, environmental degradation including pollution and a host of other factors account for such a situation,” he said. He argued that 15 million fishermen dwelling in 3,288 marine fishing villages in nine maritime states and four Union territories and several other villages of inland waterways contribute a great deal to the socio-economic development of India. Their toil elevated India as the second largest producer of fish in the world. The total fish production in 2017-18 was estimated at 12.6 million tonnes, which is 6.3% of the global fish production. The sector exports 13.77 tonnes of 50 different fish varieties to 75 countries fetching a foreign exchange revenue of Rs 45,107 crore and provides employment to over 11 million people, he said. The long-deprived community and its occupation require special treatment like the SCs and STs, which can be accomplished only by an exclusive ministry, he said. Collector makes arrangement to rescue ab.description: TIRUVANNAMALAI: After an exclusive story appeared in TOI on Tuesday, about a 45-year old Irula man being abducted by a contractor, Tiruvannamalai district collector K S Kandasamy alerted the revenue officials in Tuticorin on Wednesday and planned to rescue him. Based on the district collector’s order, a team of revenue officials from Kovilpati is likely to hand over Murugan at the Tiruvannamalai collector office by Wednesday night. Murugan, a daily wager, and his family including wife Selvi and younger son Muniyappan, 20, who were living at Reddikuppam irula colony near Vandhavasi had taken an advance of Rs 27,000 from Sakthivel after assuring to repay it by working for Sundar Raman, a sugarcane contractor . Even after Murugan and his son worked for a long time, when they checked balance amount to be paid, Raman said only Rs9,000 was paid and they should have work for two more years to settle the remaining amount. The duo managed to escape from the workplace and reached their native on May28 last week. However the owner Raman along with a few people arrived at Reddikuppam village and kidnapped Murugan demanding to settle the pending amount . TOI managed to trace Muniyappan with the help of Association for Rehabilitation of Rescued Bonded Labourers, an NGO. Speaking to TOI, collector K S Kandasamy said that based on the alert made by TOI the revenue offficials at Kovilpati were alerted. However, Murugan told that he consented to work there.“We have made arrangement to bring Murugan to the Tiruvannamalai district collector office, after recording his statement in front of revenue officials further actions would be taken he said. Chandrababu Naidu.description: KURNOOL: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday launched a blistering attack on Andhra Pradesh chief minister and erstwhile ally N Chandrababu Naidu, calling him 'u-turn Babu', whose "intent" was not on state's development. Addressing a well-attended election rally here, he sought to reject Naidu's repeated attacks that his government neglected the state. Andhra Pradesh goes to siumultaneous elections to the 175-member assembly and 25 Lok Sabha seats in the first phase on April 11 with the BJP contesting them alone. Listing various initiatives taken by the NDA government for Andhra Pradesh, Modi said it was during his regime that the Vizag-Chennai industrial corridor was flagged off and approval for the first National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT) given. It was also the 'chowkidar' who cleared the first Indian Institute of Packaging (IIP) besides approving the greenfield petrochemical complex for the state, he said. "Five years ago, your one vote made me PM. Your Pradhan sewak worked selflessly day and night for the people of the country. Chowkidar kept the interest of the state in mind," he said. Modi also recalled that the NDA government sanctioned first central university in Anantpur. He accused Naidu, the Telugu Desam Party supremo, of pasting state government 'stickers' on the Central schemes. "For sure, I could have done more work. I just required the cooperation of the state government. I made all efforts from my side, but the person who is running the government (Naidu), his intention is not Andhra Pradesh's development," Modi said. Levelling charges of corruption and dynasty politics against Naidu, he said the election date of April 11 will usher in the "double engine" of the state's growth -- a BJP government both at the Centre and the state. There was debate going on in AP that there were 'schemes for corruption,' ranging from the creation of the new capital Amravati, the Prime Minister charged. "The people of Andhra Pradhesh know whose coffers are being filled.. when this chowkidar sought accounts, u-turn Babu took a u-turn from AP's growth and walked out from NDA," Modi lashed out. Naidu had snapped ties with the NDA in March last year, accusing the Centre of not honouring the "promised" special category status to Andhra Pradesh. Hitting out at the TDP supremo for getting close to the Congress, Modi said Naidu has "found friends who are on bail," apparently referring to Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi who are on bail in the National Herald case. Modi, who had in the past hit out at Naidu for alleged family politics, said the election should also see the "son set", and called for a new "sun rise." He deliberately stressed on the "son" part to drive home his point on dynasty politics targeting the AP chief minister and his son and state minister Nara Lokesh. Without elaborating, Modi mocked that Pakistan has now accepted Naidu's "friends" as "hero." Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Urmila Matondkar.description: MUMBAI: The Congress on Friday nominated actress Urmila Matondkar and former Lok Sabha speaker Meira Kumar from Mumbai North and Bihar's Sasaram parliamentary constituencies respectively. The party renominated its sitting MP Ranjet Ranjan from Supaul in Bihar, as it released a list of another 12 candidates for the general elections. With this list, the Congress has so far nominated 305 Lok Sabha candidates. Urmila Matondkar to contest from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency on a Congress ticket.… https://t.co/JweKWNh1FN— ANI (@ANI) 1553836382000It also changed its candidate in Uttar Pradesh's Maharajganj by now fielding Supriya Shrinate in place of Tanushree Tripathi, the daughter of jailed politician Amarmani Tripathi, after facing widespread criticism. "The Congress central election committee has approved the candidature of Urmila Matondkar as party candidate to contest the ensuing general elections from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency in Maharashtra," a party statement said. Matondkar had joined the Congress after meeting Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday and had later said that she was "here to stay". Meira Kumar have been contesting from her Sasaram parliamentary constituency for many years but had lost in the 2014 Lok Sabha polls. Apart from Supriya Shrinate, in the list of 12 candidates released by the party, four are from Bihar and seven from Odisha. The Congress also released a list of 20 candidates for Odisha Assembly election. Ensure submission of audited reports of.description: Puducherry: As chief minister V Narayanasamy, who holds the portfolio of finance, began holding consultative meetings with his cabinet colleagues, secretaries and heads of the departments to prepare and finalize the budget for the fiscal year 2019-20, lieutenant governor Kiran Bedi has directed the government to allocate sufficient funds to not only pay salaries to the government servants but also the pensions and other perks to the employees on retirement on time. Of late, the government has not been settling the retirement benefits to its employees on time on superannuation. The government has not settled the gratuity and commutation value to the employees, who retired from service since November 2018. Similarly, the government has not settled the earned leave encashment to the employees who retired from service since May 2018. The government needs close to Rs 150 crore to clear all the dues to the retired employees. Bedi has been insisting the government accord top priority in extending retirement benefits to the employees on time. She has been urging the government to release all dues including the gratuity to the employees on the day of their retirement. She had earlier directed the secretary (finance) to initiate steps to authorize the department of accounts and treasuries to draw funds from other heads to settle the dues of the retired employees. “…I have seen many retired personnel suffer for timely release of pensions and other allowances/ entitlements. Take necessary steps to honour the commitments. Many have to go to courts or keep complaining and suffer. We must settle the bills,” she said in a WhatsApp group post. Bedi has also directed the government headed by Narayanasamy to ensure that the public-sector undertakings (PSUs) and government-run societies that defaulted to contribute EPF and ESI to settle the dues immediately. “Return the provident funds of employees where ever diverted. Such diversion calls for criminal liabilities,” she warned. She noted that several PSUs and societies have failed to complete the annual audit and submit the duly audited statements to the heads of the parent departments and the secretaries concerned. Some PSUs and societies have not submitted their annual audit statements for several years, she observed. She also insisted the government review the action taken by the PSUs and societies concerned on the audit reports of Comptroller and auditor general (CAG) of India, Union home ministry and others. She was of the strong opinion that the government will gain the confidence of the people if they implement these financial measures. “It is the duty of all concerned at the helm of responsibility to ensure these basics in the annual budget,” she said. Nagpur BJP Candidate List.description: NAGPUR: After deadline for withdrawal for the first phase of Lok Sabha polls, 31 out of 147 candidates, whose nomination papers were found valid in seven constituencies of Vidarbha, have withdrew their papers. Now, 116 candidates are in the election fray, according chief electoral officer. Those remaining in the fray across seven constituencies are — Wardha – 14, Ramtek – 16, Nagpur – 30, Bhandara-Gondia – 14, Chandrapur – 13, Yavatmal-Washim – 24 and Gadchiroli-Chimur – 5. BJP leaders in Bhandara-Gondia are heaving a sigh of relief as two of the four rebels, Khushal Bopche and Prakash Malgave, have withdrawn from the fray after hours of persuasion by them. However, Rajendra Patle is still in the fray. Virendra Jaiswal, who resigned from BJP before nominations, is not being considered rebel as he contests every time. BJP’s Sunil Mendhe is pitted against Nana Panchbudhe of NCP here. Bopche’s rebellion had created panic in the BJP camp as he is popular in the Pawar community and in general among OBCs. In Nagpur, Abdul Karim Patel and Ravikant Meshram, withdrew on Thursday, taking the total number to three. Pallavi Nandeshwar had withdrawn on Wednesday. In Ramtek, Sachin Shende, Gajanan Jambhulkar, Prakash Tembhurne, Ranjit Saphelkar and Lalit Shamkuwar have opted out of the race. In Yavatmal-Washim and Wardha, seven and two candidates respectively withdrew on the final day. One independent candidate withdrew his nomination in Gadchiroli-Chimur constituency on Thursday. (With inputs from TO Abraham & Balwant Dhage) Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Satta Market.description: BHOPAL: This assembly  is turning out to be a nail-biter. The Bhopal satta bazaar that gave BJP a good chance three weeks ago is suddenly abuzz about Congress’ prospects. As per the bookies, till about a month ago, if a person placed a bet of Rs 10,000 on BJP, he would get Rs 11,000 if the party returned to power. And anyone who bet Rs 4,400 on Congress would get Rs 10,000 if the opposition wins. This week, bookies say, they are taking bets on number of seats and not on who would form the government. “In case no party gets absolute majority, or if the scoreline is too close,” explained a bookie. “We do not want to say which party will form the government. The bets are open. The satta market is running good this poll season, as it is a thrilling contest,” he added. Bookies told TOI that satta trends may not reflect the actual situation on the ground, but the market is accepting bets on 116-plus seats for Congress and 102 or more for ruling BJP. “Anyone who bets successfully on BJP or Congress will double his money,” a bookie said, adding that this trend may change just as suddenly in the next few days as campaigning gets more intense. The same bookie had told TOI around a month ago that rates may vary once candidates are finalised by the parties, “but we expect the trend to remain the same”. The satta market runs into crores in every election. Bets are placed not just over phone, but also on websites and apps, leaving almost no room for police to track down bookies and those placing bets. Probably, this is why no gang has been busted in the state so far for running an election betting racket. At least two cases of betting are registered daily in Bhopal, but the people pulling the strings of the racket in poll season are yet to be caught. Police officers say it is getting increasingly difficult to nab such gangs because they are constantly on the move. “Online betting can be operated even from a moving car, a café or any public place anywhere in the country. Those running the betting in Bhopal may be sitting anywhere on the globe,” said an officer. SP-south Rahul Kumar Lodha said a special campaign is being run against criminals involved in gambling and betting ahead of elections. “These criminals are made to sign bonds to prevent them from committing such crimes in the future. Raids are being conducted on specific tips. A list of habitual offenders is being prepared by police stations to curb such illegal activities,” he said. ASP-crime Rashmi Mishra said the crime branch has activated its network of informers prior to elections to keep an eye on betting. “It is difficult to crack online betting and gambling rackets, but police take action against criminals on specific inputs. For instance, we were tipped off on Monday night about a betting den in Kolar. It was raided but no such activity was found,” Mishra said, adding that the cyber cell is constantly on the lookout for websites and mobile apps used by betting rackets. Former Puducherry chief minister Janakir.description: PUDUCHERRY: The mortal remains of former Puducherry chief minister R V Janakiraman, who passed away here on Monday after a prolonged illness, was laid to rest with full state honours and with 21-gun salute in his native village -- Alathur -- in Villupuram district of Tamil Nadu on Tuesday morning. The mortal remains of the DMK leader had been kept for public homage at his residence on the Ambour Salai here till 8am and was taken by road to his native village. A host of leaders, including DMK president M K Stalin and Puducherry chief minister V Narayanasamy, attended the funeral and paid homage to the departed soul. Later, speaking to reporters, Narayanasamy recalled the services of the late leader. He said Janakiraman, who hailed from a humble background, had worked hard to rise to prominence by becoming an MLA and minister and later the chief minister, serving the Union territory efficiently. Narayanasamy said Janakiraman, who joined the DMK at a young age, had a great admiration and respect for late DMK leader M Karunanidhi and his family, including his son Stalin. Narayanasamy said the late leader had not been active in politics for the past two years due to poor health. Janakiraman had been bed-ridden due to Parkinsonism, seizure disorder and a chronic kidney disease. He was admitted to Pondicherry Institute of Medical Sciences on June 2. His condition deteriorated at 12.30am on June 10. He passed away at 2.30am on the same day. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Government to observe 3-day mourning for.description: PUDUCHERRY: Former chief minister and DMK leader R V Janakiraman passed away in a private hospital here in the early hours of Monday after a prolonged old age-related illness. He was 78. He breathed his last at 2.30am at Pondicherry institute of medical sciences (Pims) where he was undergoing treatment. Janakiraman was admitted at Pims at 3am on June 2. He was bed-ridden for a prolonged period due to parkinsonism, seizure disorder and chronic kidney disease. His condition deteriorated at 12.30am on June 10 after he had profound hypotension. He passed away at 2.30am on the same day. Janakiraman’s body was kept at his residence on Gingee Salai for the public to pay homage until 7pm on Monday. The last rites will be held in his native village -- Alathur -- in Villupuram district of Tamil Nadu at 10am on Tuesday. DMK president M K Stalin, PMK founder-leader S Ramadoss, Puducherry lieutenant governor Kiran Bedi, chief minister V Narayanasamy and a host of Congress and DMK leaders condoled the death of Janakiraman. Narayanasamy said the late chief minister would be laid to rest with full state honours. The government will extend a state funeral to the departed leader.  The Puducherry government will observe state mourning for three days from June 10 as a mark of respect to the departed soul. There shall be no official entertainment during the period of state mourning and the national flag will be flown at half-mast for three days from June 10 through the Union territory of Puducherry. Stalin in his condolence message said late DMK leader M Karunanidhi honoured Janakiramnan with ‘Anna Award’ as early as in 2005. He said Janakiraman remained loyal to Karunanidhi and the party until his last breath and strived hard to develop the party in the Union territory. Ramadoss while condoling the death of the DMK leader recalled how Janikaraman despite hailing from a simple background worked hard to raise high in the political ladder and became the Puducherry chief minister. Bedi said Puducherry lost one of its veteran political leaders with the passing away of Janakiraman. "As chief minister of Puducherry and DMK party veteran leader, he was known for its astuteness in politics and administration. My deep condolences to the grieved family members and its followers," she said in the message. Janakiraman’ had served as Puducherry chief minister between 1996 and 2000. He was elected from Nellithope constituency for five consecutive terms (1985, 1990, 1991, 1996 and 2001). He lost to AIADMK candidate Om Sakthi Sekar in 2006 and 2011 assembly polls. After being diagnosed with parkinsonism, seizure disorder and chronic kidney disease, Janakiraman had not been active in the political sphere for the past few years. AP BJP List 2019.description: NEW DELHI: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), on Thursday, announced its first candidate list for the Lok Sabha elections 2019 that includes 184 candidates. The party has named two candidates from Andhra Pradesh in the first list. Kanna Lakshminarayana will contest from Narasaraopet Lok Sabha constituency while D Purandeshwari will contest from the Visakhapatnam seat. Andhra Pradesh will go to polls in a single phase on April 11. BJP's Lok Sabha first full list The Lok Sabha elections will be held in seven phases from April 11 to May 19, 2019. The counting of the votes has been scheduled for May 23. The first phase will be held on April 11, second on April 18, third on April 23 and fourth on April 29, fifth on May 6, sixth on May 12 and seventh phase on May 19. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will contest from Varanasi constituency, while BJP president Amit Shah will fight from Gandhinagar in place of L K Advani. As many as 90 crore electors, including 1.59 crore new voters aged 18-19 years, are registered to vote in the upcoming general election. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Sadhvi Pragya.description: NEW DELHI: BJP MP from Bhopal Sadhvi Pragya Singh Thakur created a controversy on the first day of 17th Lok Sabha on Monday when she suffixed the name of her spiritual guru with hers while taking oath, drawing objections from the opposition. Amid protests and shoutings, Thakur said that it was her full name and she had already mentioned it in the form she had filled for oath taking. The mention of Swami Purna Chetnanand Avdheshanand Giri as suffix to her name evoked sharp reaction from the opposition members who said that such a thing was not permitted. She insisted that the suffix was part of her full name, resulting in an uproar from opposition and slogan shouting in her favour from the ruling benches. Following the din, Pro-tem Speaker Virendra Kumar asked the Lok Sabha secretary general about Pragya's full name. Amid noise and objections, Kumar ruled that only the name written in her election certificate issued by the returning officer would go on record. Thakur, the Malegaon blast accused, took oath in Sanskrit and ended it with 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' slogan. Thakur defeated Congress stalwart Digvijay Singh to enter the Lok Sabha for the first time. Later, BJP members continued to raise 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' slogans, teasing the opposition. They started raising slogan after oath taking by every BJP member. After Ganjendra Umarao Singh Patel (BJP) completed his oath with 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai', N K Premchandran (RSP) urged the Pro tem Speaker to maintain the prescribed format of the oath. The Pro tem speaker ruled that the members stick to the format provided. After this, the members of BJP started adding 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' after end of every oath. Some of the prominent names who took oath from Madhya Pradesh included K P Yadav who defeated Jyotiraditya Scindia, Rakesh Singh, Ramakant Bhargava and Nakul Nath. Indore MP Shankar Lalwani took oath in Sindhi. In Video:Lok Sabha: Sadhvi Pragya made to take oath againDownload The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

BJP List 2019 Karnataka.description: BENGALURU: The BJP on Thursday released its first list of 21 candidates from Karnataka, but it does not include the names of sitting MP Karadi Sanganna (Koppal) or late Union minister HN Ananth Kumar’s wife Tejaswini, who is widely tipped to be the candidate from Bengaluru South. The list names the 14 other sitting MPs, including Shobha Karandlaje (Udupi-Chikkamagalur) and Suresh Angadi (Belagavi) despite stiff opposition within the party and anti-incumbency against the two. Party leaders said they are baffled by the exclusion of Tejaswini’s name and are unaware of the reasons for her candidature being withheld. “We inaugurated her personal office on Thursday and were sure of her name being announced,” one leader said. Rumours — from “technical” errors to the possibility that her name would lead to comments on “dynasty politics” — are doing the rounds. Sanganna’s candidature was withheld as the BJP is waiting for the JD(S)-Congress coalition to name its candidate. With the possibility of former chief minister Siddaramaiah contesting, the BJP will require a stronger candidate. The party also decided not to announce its candidate for Mandya, but two Congress rebels — A Manju from Hassan and Umesh Jadhav from Kalaburagi — have been given tickets. BSY has his wayThe first list confirms that the BJP central leadership continues to repose faith in state party president and Lingayat strongman BS Yeddyurappa. The list features names of his son BY Raghavendra and several confidants. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Vellore: Sand smuggler attempts to run o.description: VELLORE: The Thiruvalam police arrested a 35-year-old sand smuggler who attempted to run over a special sub-inspector of police when he tried to stop a truck being used to smuggle sand illegally at Ammundi on Palar riverbed on Monday. Police said based on a secret information that sand was smuggled by a gang from Palar river bank near Ammundi, a police team headed by SSI Venkatesan went to the spot. When the SSI tried to stop a lorry making his way out from the river, the driver tried to knock him down and sped away. SSI Venkatesan who had a narrow escape chased the lorry and managed to nab the accused. Police identified the accused as Bala alias Balamurugan, a resident of Mariamman Temple Street in Ammundi. Bala confessed to his involvement in illegal mining of sand for more than two years. Further investigation are on. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Puducherry: UG, PG seats in arts, scienc.description: PUDUCHERRY: The Puducherry government has increased the number of undergraduate and postgraduate arts and science seats in the government colleges by 25% for the academic year 2019-20. Minister R Kamalakkannan said number of seats in 11 government colleges has been increased from 5,199 in academic year 2018-19 to 6,475 in the academic year 2019-20. He said the government has been steadily enhancing the number of seats in government colleges every academic year. He said numbers of seats in government colleges was increased from 3,858 in 2016-17 to 5,065 in 2017-18 and to 5,199 in 2018-19. He said the government has proposed to recruit 150 additional teaching faculty members on contract basis shortly. He said all the 11 government colleges have been directed to opt for accreditation by the National assessment and accreditation council (Naac). He assured that all the government colleges will have fulltime permanent principals within three months’ time. The minister said the government has proposed to introduce management information system (MIS) in schools. Secretary A Anbarasu said the government has introduced two new courses– BSc (psychology) in Kasturba Gandhi arts and science college and BA (public administration) in Arignar Anna government arts and science college in Karaikal from this year with 60 seats each. He said the government increased 70 seats in Kanchi Mamunivar centre for postgraduate studies, 420 seats in Tagore arts college, 180 seats in Bharathidasan government college for women, 150 seats in Arignar Anna government arts and science college, 186 seats in Avvaiyar government college for women, 100 seats in Indira Gandhi college of arts and science, 100 seats in Kasturba Gandhi arts and science college, 20 seats in Rajiv Gandhi arts and science college and 50 seats in Perumthalaivar Kamarajar arts and science college. \u2018Direct Centre, state governments t.description: PUDUCHERRY: The Indian institute of community development has urged Prime Minister Narendra Modi to direct the Niti Ayog, which convenes on June 15, to examine whether the Union and state governments have fulfilled their ‘constitutional responsibilities’ of empowering the local bodies. The institute chairman V A Vasudevaraju in a letter addressed to Modi pointed out that the 73rd and 74th amendment of the Constitution in 1993 made grassroots-level planning mandatory and declared that the Union and state governments have ‘constitutional responsibilities’ of establishing a system for grassroots level planning. “But it was not given the serious attention it deserves by the (successive) governments…The Niti Ayog meeting on June 15 may examine the compliance of the Articles concerned (243 G, 243 I, 243 L 243 W, 243 ZD and 243 ZE) of the Constitution by the Union and state governments,”: he said in the letter. Article 243 G empowers village panchayats to prepare and implement plans for economic development and social justice while 243 I to constitute a finance commission to review its financial position and 243 L empowers panchayats in Union territories also to enjoy similar such powers. Article 243 W empowers municipalities to prepare and implement plans for economic development and social justice while 243 ZD empowers municipalities and panchayats to constitute a committee for district planning and 243 ZE empowers them to constitute a committee for metropolitan planning. “All the state governments may be requested to submit a factual statement on the above-mentioned matter to facilitate the future course of action to adhere to the constitutional mandate by the Union and state governments,” he said. He pointed out that the concept of ‘planning from below’ has been long-neglected for the past 70 years in the country. “Till 1993, it was not a constitutional issue. But after 1993 when Part IX and Part XI A were added to the Constitution by the 73rd and 74th amendments, ‘planning from below’ has become the ‘constitutional responsibilities’ of the Union and state governments,” he said. Have set up separate wards to treat Nipa.description: PUDUCHERRY: The Puducherry cabinet convened under the chairmanship of chief minister V Narayanasamy, on Friday afternoon. The cabinet convened for the first time after the Supreme Court directed the Puducherry government not to implement any decision having financial implications until June 21. Speaking to reporters after chairing an almost two-hour long meeting, Narayanasamy listed out the decisions taken by the cabinet. He said the health officials in Mahe, territory’s enclave in Kerala where the incidence of Nipah infection has been reported, have set up a separate wards to extend treatment for any patient who tested positive for the virus. He said the health officials have also started screening of patients for Nipah infection. He said he had directed the director (health and family welfare) in Puducherry to take all precautionary measures to prevent an outbreak of Nipah and ensure adequate stock of medicines for treatment. He said the Adi Dravidar welfare department will be renamed as Adi Dravidar and Tribal welfare department after the Union government recognized the presence of Irulars (scheduled tribes) in the Union territory. The cabinet also decided to continue implementation of free rice scheme, review holding a caste-wise survey and revive the sick Pondicherry cooperative sugar mill at Lingareddipalayam. Villupuram: Cops bust rave party, 16 hel.description: VILLUPURAM: Based on a tip, sleuths attached to the Villupuram district narcotics intelligence wing along with the Auroville police, busted a rave party at a cashew grove in Irumbai village on the wee hours of Sunday. Police detained R Yuvaraj, 36, of Manapakkam who was the organiser of the party. Based on his confession police arrested 16 more people, including Likath , Prabu , Ramachandran, who were in-charge of setting up the stage, disco lights and sound effects. Police seized Puducherry-made IMFL liquor and 125 grams of marijuana from the spot. Saravanan, inspector incharge of Auroville said, “After conducting a preliminary inquiry, we found that Yuvaraj had organized the rave party for his friend P Haji of Coimbatore and some of his close associates. Haji had also invited a few foreign nationals at the party.”  Some foreigners, including women, who had attended the party were released by the Auroville police after a warning. Saravanan said the Villupuram narcotics intelligence wing along with a team from Auroville police station reached the property of G Balaraman of Alangkuppam village around 11:30 pm. Police officials registered a case on 8 sections including 147 and 294a of IPC , 4(1)a and 4 (1)(i) Tamil Nadu Prohibition act and 3 (A) town nuisance act. On information Villupuram SP S Jayakumar came to the spot and conducted inquiry with the arrested. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Sainik welfare department issues applica.description: PUDUCHERRY: The department of sainik welfare will issue application forms to seek reimbursement of tuition fees, allowance for books and uniforms for the wards of unemployed and non-income tax assesses ex-servicemen of Puducherry for the academic year 2018-19 from June 10 to July 12. Director (sainik welfare) in a statement advised all eligible beneficiaries to collect the application forms from the department during working hours by producing the identity cards issued by the department. The last date for submitting filled in application forms with original fee receipts and bills to the director, department of sainik welfare is August 2. He directed the ex-servicemen in Karaikal, Mahe and Yanam regions to approach respective chief educational officers for availing the benefits. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Beach in Puducherry selected for blue fl.description: PUDUCHERRY: The Union environment, forest and climate control ministry has proposed to seek ‘blue flag certification’ for at least one beach in each of the 13 coastal states and Union territories in the country under the World Bank-funded Integrated Coastal Zone Management Project (ICZMP). Blue flag certification is accorded by the Denmark-based Foundation for Environment Education (FEE) to the beaches that fulfil 33 stringent criteria for reducing existing pollution, managing solid waste and marine litter, adopting eco-friendly measures, improving seawater quality for bathing, enhancing safety and security measures and promoting tourism and allied initiatives among others. Once the beaches receive blue flag certification, FEE will mention them in its global headquarters. The tourists, who are familiar with blue flag certification and its standards, will plan their holidays in those countries. The ministry’s body – Society of integrated coastal management (Sicom) – in coordination with FEE launched a pilot coastal management project (Beams – Beach environment and aesthetics management services) to select beaches that can meet the requirements for blue flag certification in the country. The society after undertaking extensive fieldwork has selected 13 beaches including one in Puducherry (Eden in Chinna Veerampattinam) for the globally-applauded blue flag beach certification. The ministry launched a series of campaigns to realize the goal of attaining the eco-label for the selected beaches in the country. The campaign in Puducherry was formally launched during the world environment day celebrations on Wednesday. The initiatives include massive cleaning of the beach with eco-friendly tools and equipment, segregating and recycling of garbage and imparting environment education to members of the local communities, fishermen societies and school children. A team from the National centre for sustainable coastal management visited Puducherry a week ago and took seawater samples for checking the quality. The team also did a bathymetric survey to analyse under-seawater features and wave current and intensity. If the survey results meet the blue flag criterion, the ministry will earmark 500m-800m stretch of the beach and will establish an effective solid waste management system, watch tower with experienced lifeguards to save people from drowning, bathing facilities at international standards besides providing clean drinking water through a reverse osmosis plant and installing solar power generating units. The country has proposed to secure certification for 10 beaches in 2019-20. Shivrajpur (Dwarka in Gujarat) and Ghoghia (Daman & Diu) are ready for certification this season while four other beaches will be ready for certification by the next season. "The target is to develop at least 50 to 100 blue flag beaches in India in the next five years," said Sicom mission leader Sanjai Jalla. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Government failed to tackle water crisis.description: VELLORE: Stating that the AIADMK government had failed to solve the state’s water crisis, TNCC president K S Azhagiri on Sunday demanded the government to come out with a white paper on fund allocation, fund utilisation and projects to be executed to tackle the water scarcity. He said there were allegations that the AIADMK government had swindled Rs 300 crore in the free laptop districution scheme to students, by distributing substandard laptops. He demanded that the chief minister should form a committee compromising of all-party legislators to monitor the free laptop distribution scheme.Azhagiri said the government was struggling to supply drinking water to the public, which was aggravating the already dire situation. Bilingual writer Raja received first Dup.description: Puducherry: Bilingual writer P Raja bagged the first ‘Dupuis Award’ instituted by Natural Learning Movement of Puducherry and Rev Fr Louis Savenian Dupuis Historical Commission of Puducherry to identify and honour best writers in the Union territory. The movement president Justice David Annousamy and the commission president Fr A S Antonisamy presented the award to Raja in a simple function in the Immaculate Conception Cathedral. Raja has so far published more than 5,000 articles, short stories, poems and one-act plays. He also served as a general council member (English advisory board) of Central Sahitya Akademi, New Delhi. A retired professor in English, Raja is also a folklorist and translator. He is also the editor of Transfire, a quarterly devoted to translations from various languages into English.  He served as an expert committee member for the central plan scheme for the development of Tamil in Central Institute of Indian Languages, Mysore. Centac commences UG medical, dental, Ayu.description: PUDUCHERRY: The Centralized admission committee (Centac) has invited applications for admissions into undergraduate medical (MBBS), dental (BDS), Ayurvedic medicine (BAMS) and veterinary science (BVSc) courses from June 4 (5pm) to June 16 for the academic year 2019-20. The committee will fill the seats based on the ranks of students in the National eligibility cum entrance test (Neet). However, BVSc seats under Puducherry quota will be filled based on the higher secondary marks of the students while BVSc seats under self-supporting national quota and NRI quotas will be filled based on the Neet rank of the students. The committee will fill 106 MBBS seats under government quota and 22 seats under NRI quota in Indira Gandhi medical college and research institute, 42 BAMS seats under government quota and seven seats under NRI quota in Rajiv Gandhi Ayurveda medical college, Mahe, 29 BDS seats under government quota and five seats under NRI quota in Mahatma Gandhi postgraduate institute of dental sciences, 12 BVSc seats under national quota and four seats under NRI quota in Rajiv Gandhi institute of veterinary education and research. It will fill 54 MBBS seats under government quota, 46 seats under management quota (all India rank) and 50 seats under Puducherry minority quota (Christians) in Pondicherry institute of medical science, 55 MBBS seats under government quota and 95 under management quota in Sri Manakula Vinayagar medical college and hospital, 55 MBBS seats under government quota and 20 seats under management quota and 75 seats under Puducherry minority quota (Telugu) in Sri Venkateshwaraa medical college and research institute. It will fill 50 BDS seats under government quota and 50 under management quota in Mahe institute of dental sciences and 50 BDS seats under government quota and 50 under Puducherry minority quota (Telugu) in Sri Venkateshwaraa dental college. The committee will update the seat matrix later in its website, said a release. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Pondy police impose speed restrictions i.description: PUDUCHERRY: Police have imposed speed restrictions in the town limits and suburbs to prevent over-speeding that leads to frequent accidents in the tiny but congested Union territory. Director general of police Sundari S Nanda said the restrictions will come into force with immediate effect (June 4). Police department has procured speed laser guns and an interceptor vehicle of the Institute of road traffic education to identify violators and issue them e-challans. The maximum speed limit from the old distillery to Park guesthouse on Beach Road was fixed at 20kmph while town area within and including the four boulevards at 30kmph. Similarly, the maximum speed limit on Cuddalore road (from Vengatta Subba Reddiyar Square to Ariyankuppam bridge, from Ariyankuppam bridge to Mullodi border - within Puducherry region near educational institutions, residential and industrial area and market places and hospitals) was fixed at 30kmph. The maximum speed limit from Ariyankuppam Bridge, Villianur to Madagadipet border within Puducherry region (near educational institutions, residential and industrial areas, market places and hospitals), Beach Road to Ariyankuppam Bridge, the entire stretch of Kamaraj Salai, Vazhuthavour Road, MG Raod from Subbaiah Salai to Muthialpet Market, Marapalam junction to Muthialpet Market (ECR) and from Muthialpet market to Kanagachettikulam border within Puducherry region (near educational institutions, residential and industrial areas, market places and hospitals), was fixed at 30kmph. The maximum speed limit on open roads from Muthialpet market to Kanagachettikulam border, from Ariyankuppam Bridge to Mullodai border and from Ariyankuppam Bridge, Villlianur to Madagadipet border was fixed at 50kmph. Tiruvannamalai collector allots free hou.description: TIRUVANNAMALAI: Days after a 45-year-old man from the Irula community was rescued, Tiruvannamalai collector K S Kandasamy on Sunday allotted a free government house to him.  The man, Murugan, was allegedly abused and ill treated by a sugarcane contractor after confining him at Kengampatti village in Tuticorin district. Murugan and his family, including his wife Selvi, 40, and younger son Muniyappan, 20, lived at Reddikuppam Irula Colony near Vandhavasi. They took an advance of Rs 27,000 from a broker named Sakthivel, on the condition that they will repay the the money by working under a sugarcane contractor. Despite toiling long hours at the farm, the contractor told them recently that only Rs 9,000 of the advance had been paid off so far and they must work for two more years to settle the remaining Rs 18,000. The family feared that they would die due to the workload, and managed to escape from the farm. They reached their native village on May 28. However, the contractor, Sundar Raman, along with his accomplices, came to Reddikuppam village and abducted Murugan. Based on a TOI report, Tiruvannamalai collector conducted an inquiry with Murugan’s son Muniyappan on June 4. Murugan was rescued with the help of Tuticorin district administration officials on the same day. On Sunday, the collector met Murugan at Cheyyar revenue office had handed over the order to allot a free house worth Rs 2.60 lakh to his. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Arvind Kejriwal.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi has refused to forge an alliance with the AAP for the Lok Sabha polls in the national capital. Full coverage: Lok Sabha electionsTalking to reporters at the airport here, the AAP leader said he had met Gandhi recently and the Congress leader had refused to “join hands with the AAP”. Asked about Congress' Delhi unit president Sheila Dikshit's remarks that Kejriwal never approached her for an alliance, the chief minister said, “We have met Rahul Gandhi. Dikshit is not that important leader.” Kejriwal has been urging the Congress to stitch an alliance in Delhi for the Lok Sabha polls to keep the BJP away from power. Leaders in the Delhi unit of the Congress were divided over the issue of alliance with Dikshit and her three working presidents opposing it, party sources had said. A top source in the party had recently said that chances of alliance were "slim" considering its long term repercussions in Delhi. "The biggest question is how will Congress face the AAP in Assembly elections due in 2020 after the tie up. Also, the party does not gain much politically as it is being offered only 2-3 seats by Kejriwal," the source had said. Congress had drawn a blank in the 2014 parliamentary elections in Delhi. The talk of alliance was fuelled by the fact that the Congress and AAP had jointly polled more votes than the BJP that had walked away with all the seven seats in the national capital. Delhi has 7 Lok Sabha seats and it will go to polls on May 12. Jimper publishes list of shortlisted can.description: Puducherry: Jawaharlal institute of postgraduate medical education and research (Jipmer) has published the list of shortlisted candidates for admission into the MBBS programme for 2019 season on its website http://jipmer.edu.in/. The institute will hold the first counselling for admission into the MBBS programme between June 26 and 28. It will hold counselling for the unreserved / persons with disability (including Puducherry candidates) on June 26, for other backward classes / scheduled caste / scheduled tribe candidates on June 27 and for unreserved, other backward classes, scheduled caste, scheduled tribes (Puducherry candidates) and non-resident Indian and overseas citizens of India on June 28. Tamil Nadu: Patient with suspected Nipah.description: PUDUCHERRY: The 53-year-old resident of Cuddalore district, who was admitted to the Jawaharlal Institute of Postgraduate Medical Education and Research (Jipmer) with symptoms akin to that of Nipah infection on Sunday, continues to be in a critical state. “The patient was admitted in a semiconscious state on Sunday. He continues to be critical. His condition neither worsened nor improved. He is responding only to a painful stimulus,” said Jipmer medical superintendent A S Badhe. The patient has been kept at an exclusive isolated infectious diseases ward as the symptoms are like that of Nipah infection. Moreover, he has been working in Guruvayur in Kerala, where a patient tested positive for Nipah infection. “He is undergoing treatment at the isolated ward after the team treating him suspected him to have Nipah infection. He is on ventilator. The functions of other vital organs are normal. The institute will treat him like a Nipah patient, taking all precautionary measures to prevent the spreading of the infection. The team members treating him have been advised to take all precautionary measures,” said Badhe. He said the institute has sent the samples of the patient to the national institute of virology in Pune on Tuesday for testing. “We are expecting the test results tomorrow (Thursday),” he said. There is no specific treatment for Nipah infection. “We can extend only supportive treatment like ventilator support, administering IV fluids and follow the treatment modules adopted for non-Nipah infections,” he said. The institute’s isolation ward has four rooms that can accommodate up to six patients. “Presently only one patient with suspected Nipah infection is in the isolation ward. The institute has all necessary facilities to treat any flu infection,” he said. The Puducherry government has made necessary arrangements to prevent any outbreak of Nipah virus after the suspected case was reported at Jipmer.
