SC has upheld democracy, says Narayanasa.description: Puducherry: The Supreme Court’s interim order has upheld democracy, Puducherry chief minister V Narayanasamy said on Tuesday. He told reporters that lieutenant governor Kiran Bedi’s efforts to get an interim stay on the Madras high court order failed. The additional solicitor general of India, appearing on behalf of the Union government, sought an interim stay on the Madras high court order, but the Supreme Court denied granting any stay, he added. The Madras high court had in an April 30 order said the lieutenant governor could not run a parallel government and interfere with the day-to-day affairs of the elected government. Subsequently, the Union government moved the Supreme Court against the Madras high court order. But the vacation bench of the Supreme Court of Justices Indu Malhotra and M R Shah directed the Puducherry government not to implement any decision having financial implications until June 21. The Puducherry cabinet, which will convene on June 7, has proposed to accord approval to a slew of projects rejected by the Union home ministry. Most of the projects have been proposed in Yanam, the territory’s enclave in Andhra Pradesh. The projects include transfer of government land for various projects in Yanam, regularization of contract workers appointed in public works department in 2005, release of flood relief to the tune of over Rs 200 crore and release of grant-in-aid. A constitutional expert said the Congress government did not follow rules while convening cabinet meeting. The government proposed to convene the cabinet meeting at short notice without preparing a cabinet note and submitting the same to the secretaries of the government (law and finance) and chief secretary. “It is blatant violation of cabinet rules,” the expert said on condition of anonymity. The Justices also directed the Puducherry government not to initiate any contempt of court proceedings against the officials of the territorial administration. Chief minister's parliamentary secretary K Lakshminarayanan, the respondent in the case, had warned the officials of contempt of court proceedings if they failed to honour the Madras high court order. Second edition of Isha green school move.description: Vellore: The second edition of Isha Green School Movement – an initiative to plant 4 lakh tree saplings in Vellore – was launched at Voorhees college in Vellore town on Thursday.  Popular comedian and Kollywood actor Vivekh, Vellore district collector S A Raman and Vellore district Chief Education officer S Mars were invited as special guests for the event. Addressing the gathering CEO S Mars said, “we feel blessed to see that a joint venture by the School Education Department and Isha foundation, has successfully completed its first year and stepped into the second. Under this initiative, in the previous year the students did a good job by planting 3,11,000 tree saplings. This year it will be 4 lakh saplings,” Mars said .  S A Raman in his speech said that 100 years ago, Vellore was one among the coolest place in the state with so many trees. But today, due to a variety of reasons, the district has lost its green cover, as a result of which summers have become unbearable. He said that planting trees was the only solution to solve the problem.  Actor Vivekh, in his speech said, “Vellore is famous for two things - one is its jail, and the other, its scorching summer (Veyil). Isha has been trying to transform Vellore into a place filled with trees. The Isha Foundation is undertaking several projects for the benefit of the society and for increasing the green cover in the state ,” he said.  Recalling former president’s speech Vivekh said “In the year 2008 when I got an opportunity to meet Dr.A.P.J.Abdul Kalam,he spoke to me about the importance of tree-planting. The target given to me was to plant 1 crore trees. So far, 30 lakh saplings has been planted. In an endeavor to speed up this process, I have decided to join hands with Isha.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tamil Nadu Elections.description: Voting for Lok Sabha elections 2019 in Tamil Nadu will take place in a single phase on April 18 as per the notification issued by the Election Commission of India. The counting of votes will take place on May 23. | Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesThe four-cornered contest for the 39 Lok Sabha seats features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). Out of the 39 seats in the state, seven Lok Sabha seats are reserved for SC. The constituencies reserved for SC candidates are Thiruvallur, Kancheepuram, Villupuram, Nilgiris, Chidambaram, Nagapattinam and Tenkasi in Tamil Nadu. | Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesIn the last Lok Sabha polls, AIADMK had a vote share of 44.3 per cent by winning 37 seats. BJP had a vote share of 5.5 per cent by winning just 1 seat, while NDA managed to win two seats with a vote share of 18.5 per cent PMK won one seat and had a vote share of 4.4 per cent. BJP (NDA) had an alliance with PMK. DMK was not able to win on any seat in the last Lok Sabha polls. In Lok Sabha elections 2019, DMK is contesting on 20 seats, while the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. BJP List 2019 WB.description: KOLKATA: The BJP in its first list of 28 candidates for West Bengal has pinned hopes on its veterans and defectors from the ruling Trinamool Congress to take on the Mamata Banerjee's government in the state. Of the 28 candidates, nearly 25 are new faces, with a thrust on active political workers rather than greenhorns from the glamour world. The saffron party, which bagged two Lok Sabha seats in the 2014 elections, is now targeting 23 of the state's 42 constituencies. BJP Lok Sabha first full listUnlike the TMC list, which had 18 new faces and a mix of both old-timers and greenhorns, hardcore politicians and personalities from the film industry, the BJP has put faith on its own leaders and defectors from other parties. There are four women candidates and one Muslim nominee in the first list. Of the candidates, five had recently defected to the saffron party from the Trinamool Congress and one from the CPI(M). West Bengal: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageUnion minister and BJP MP from Asansol Lok Sabha constituency Babul Supriyo has been renominated from the same seat and is pitted against actor Moon Moon Sen of the TMC. State BJP president Dilip Ghosh will contest from Medinipur seat against TMC leader Manas Bhunia. BJP national secretary Rahul Sinha will take on TMC heavyweight Sudip Bandopadhyay in Kolkata North Lok Sabha seat. State BJP vice-president and Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose grandnephew, Chandra Kumar Bose will contest from Kolkata South Lok Sabha seat. Former IPS officer Bharati Ghosh, once known to be close to Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, will be fighting against TMC candidate and actor Dipak Adhikary, popularly known as 'Dev', from Ghatal Lok Sabha constituency. The BJP has fielded former Trinamool Congress MLA Arjun Singh from Barrackpur Lok Sabha seat. Singh, who had recently joined the saffron party, has been pitted against TMCs Dinesh Trivedi. In Coochbebar Lok Sabha seat, the party has fielded former TMC youth leader Nishith Pramanik, while in Jadavpur Lok Sabha seat, expelled TMC MP Anupam Hazra will contest against TMC's Mimi Chakraborty, an actor by profession. Another former TMC MP Soumitra Khan, who joined the BJP in January, has been given ticket from Bishnupur(SC) Lok Sabha seat. Former CPI(M) MLA Khagen Murmu, who too had switched over to the BJP, will contest from Malda North seat and will take on TMCs Mausam Benazir Noor, who had recently defected to the party from the Congress, in Malda Uttar seat. The Lok Sabha elections in the state will be held from April 11 till May 19 in seven phases. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tejasvi Surya.description: BENGALURU: From a boy who was groomed by late Union minister H N Ananth Kumar and Tejaswini Ananth Kumar to becoming the challenge to the family’s control over Bengaluru South segment, Tejasvi Surya has come a long way.While expressing his gratitude to Kumar and his family, Surya says he is a stark example of the BJP’s intent to infuse young and new blood. You were a surprise choice for Bengaluru South. Did you expect this development?While I had feelers that there was something like this going around, I was quite happily savouring pani puri with my friends. To be honest I was overwhelmed and started tweeting about this. I only feel gratitude towards the party, which is facing a crucial election and has decided to take risk by fielding a youngster in such a prestigious seat. At 28, will you be able to fill the shoes of Kumar?Filling the shoes of Ananth Kumar is a far fetched thing for he was so gigantic. I only pray to God to give me strength, sincerity and earnestness to honestly work for the people of this constituency so that one day in the eyes of the people I can match up to Kumar’s contribution to the constituency. On lack of political experience, I have a well oiled party organisational machinery to support me with senior leaders there to hand hold me. So what is this election going to be for you?Primarily it is an election for PM Narendra Modi’s aspirational India. It is about the promise of a new and young India and I am just an ambassador of the message of this new India. It is a reflection of party and Modi’s inclination of bringing in young blood. Tejaswini not getting the ticket is quite sensitive...Yes it is sensitive but even during her talk with the Karyakartas she told them that the it was time to show maturity. She has given her full support to me. But what is your personal opinion about Tejaswini missing the ticket?When her name was first finalised by the state leadership, it must be March 11, I was the first to extend my support to her and remember posting on social media that she was the most deserving candidate and a good choice from the constituency. But the party decided to field an ordinary karyakarta like me. It is a decision taken by big people and I am just a foot soldier obeying their diktat. I have always supported Tejaswini ma’am and was literally groomed by that family. I have no reason for acrimony. Statements by Karti Chidamabaram suggest that you are the Schutzstaffel of BJP, or the infamous SS of the Nazi Germany... Your tweets also suggest that your idealogical beliefs are in conflict with the “Sab Ka Saath Sab Ka Vikas” For Karti Chidambaram and others I will reply back to them in their own coin. The idealogical inclinations are not an issue for this election. The issue for the election today, is PM Modi’s promise of a new and superpower India. My only concern as on today is to ensure that Bangalore South elects the BJP with a massive margin so that we will strengthen Modi hands. Rest is immaterial. Is age an advantage or do you require time to project yourself as a leader?That the party leadership has reposed faith in me speaks for itself and the least minimum I can do is to live up to it and say I am capable enough as on today to take on these challenges. You must rise to the occasion and I will rise to it. On dynasty politics, considering you are a nephew of a sitting BJP MLA and PM Modi has gone on the offensive against the Congress on the issue of “Naamdar”...My candidature and my role and activity in politics has no connection to my uncle’s political life. I have an identity of my own and have worked very hard over years. My aspirations precedes his elections. If the party leadership thought I was a rise to another dynast, they would not have considered me at all. In Video:BJP announces 28-year-old Tejasvi Surya for Bengaluru South seatDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

BJP List 2019 Maharashtra.description: AURANGABAD/KOLHAPUR: Sitting MPs Sunil Gaikwad (Latur) and Dilip Gandhi (Ahmednagar) were denied tickets for the forthcoming Lok Sabha elections in the BJP’s first national list of candidates announced on Thursday. The list included 16 names from Maharashtra. While speculations were rife that the party would not retain Gaikwad owing to his differences with some senior BJP leaders, what came as a surprise was the ticket going to Sudhakar Shrungare, a member of the Latur zilla parishad. However, Shrungare, who is in the construction business, was the popular choice of local BJP workers. Gaikwad had won the 2014 election by a majority of over 2.5 lakh votes. Considered to be close to Union minister Nitin Gadkari, he was reportedly at loggerheads with Latur district guardian minister Sambhaji Patil-Nilangekar. The nomination of Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, from Ahmednagar instead of Gandhi was a foregone conclusion ever since he joined the party last week. Sujay, a neurosurgeon by profession, will be making his entry into politics with this nomination. His late grandfather, Balasaheb Vikhe Patil, was long associated with the Congress. | Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in MaharashtraAmong other prominent leaders from Maharashtra in the first list of candidates are Union minister Nitin Gadkari from his hometown Nagpur, state BJP chief Raosaheb Danve from Jalna, Union MoS Hansraj Ahir from Chandrapur and Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre from Dhule. Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter, Pritam, who was elected to Parliament with a record majority after her father’s death, has been renominated from Beed. Sitting MP from Sangli Sanjay Patil has also been renominated, putting an end to speculation over any change in constituency. Patil’s candidature was opposed by a section of BJP leaders in Sangli. However, chief minister Devendra Fadnavis is understood to have called a meeting of local party leaders and resolved the differences. The party has also given tickets to Heena Gavit from Nandurbar, Raksha Khadse from Raver, Poonam Mahajan from Mumbai North Central, Kapil Patil from Bhiwandi, Sanjay Dhotre from Akola, Ramdas Tadas from Wardha, Ashok Nete from Gadchiroli and Gopal Shetty from Mumbai North. Chanchal Lahiri.description: KOLKATA: After a day-long search for magician Chanchal Lahiri (41),   who disappeared   while performing an underwater escape act in the Hooghly, police on Monday fished out his body from near Howrah. Later in the evening, Lahiri's brother identified his body. An initial police probe established that Lahiri on Sunday had made several mistakes while attempting the stunt popularised by the famous illusionist and stunt performer Harry Houdini almost 100 years ago. Mandrake trying similar stunt earlierMMiC still in shock after magician’s deathLahiri, who was to come out of the water after being thrown in with his hands and feet bound, , but also wore cumbersome clothing and guards that made swimming in the strong current extremely difficult. Magician PC Sarkar, a master of such stunts, said perhaps Lahiri "needed a little more practice". Lahiri's team, too, waited about 15 minutes after he was lowered into the water to raise an alarm. Chanchal Lahiri on the boat moments before he started the stunt on Sunday Lahiri’s hands and legs were tied with ropes and he was chained with six locks. "When he did not surface for a long time, people panicked. Some onlookers said they saw a man struggling, seeking help, in the middle of the river. Police were informed and a team of divers from the disaster management group joined the rescue operation," said DC (Port) Syed Waquar Raza. Cops will probe if he took advantage of some lacunae on part of the administration and probably paid for it with his life. "A case of negligence is likely to be registered," said a source. Lahiri being lowered into the Hooghly river as he performed one of his tricks in KolkataMagician’s body found; peers say he didn’t take proper precaution Sources said Mandrake never mentioned in his permission letter that he was going to jump into the water. "Lahiri stated the stunt was to happen on a boat or vessel. Hence, we allowed him permission," Raza said. The letter added that he wanted to take photographs and perform an extra event around 1.30pm. The final dip made by Chanchal Lahiri"He performed almost an hour earlier. Hence, river traffic police was absent," said a Port division officer. Police said Lahiri drowned around 12.30pm and it is unclear whether he was performing or practising the act. Moments before the stunt on Sunday, Lahiri said, "If you perform a dangerous trick perfectly, you are a magician. If you fail, it is always tragic." Mandrake's body was fished out on Monday"Bound and chained, Mandrake was lowered 30 feet under water. Thousands watched and it is impossible the cops missed the entire episode when even politicians were present," claimed a friend on Monday. In 2013, when Lahiri performed the same stunt, he was assaulted by the crowd of onlookers, who claimed they felt cheated because they had seen through the trick. Maharashtra Lok Sabha Constituencies.description: MUMBAI: Maharashtra, which has 48 parliamentary constituencies, will go to polls in four phases, starting April 11. In 2009 and 2014, Lok Sabha elections were held in three phases in Maharashtra On April 11, seven constituencies in Maharashtra’s Vidarbha region will go to polls - Nagpur, Wardha, Yavatmal-Washim, and the naxal-affected areas of Gadchiroli and Chandrapur. In the second phase on April 18, 10 constituencies - including three constituencies in Vidarbha, six in Marathwada and Solapur in western Maharashtra - go to elections. The third phase, on April 23, of polling will be held in Pune, Baramati, Jalgaon, Jalna, Aurangabad, Raigad and Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg, Sangli, Satara and Kolhapur. In the final phase on April 29, all six constituencies in Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Palghar and Bhiwandi will go to polls among the total 17 seats in the state. KEY CONSTITUENCIESAmong the key constituencies are Baramati and Nagpur featuring high-profile candidates such as Supriya Sule and Nitin Gadkari. Then there is Ahmednagar from where Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, is contesting. Other important constituencies are Jalna, Chandrapur, Dhule, Beed, Sangli, Mumbai North Central, Mumbai North and Baramati.    CONSTITUENCIES CONTENDERS   Chandrapur Union MoS Hansraj Ahir (BJP); Suresh Dhanorkar (Congress)   Baramati Kanchan Kul (BJP); Supriya Sule (Congress)   Jalna State BJP chief Raosaheb Danve BJP; Vilas Keshavrao Autade (Congress)   Akola Sanjay Dhotre (BJP); Hidayat Patel (Congress)   Bhiwandi Kapil Patil(BJP); Suresh Kashinath Taware (Congress)    Nagpur Union minister Nitin Gadkari (BJP)   Ahmednagar Sujay Vikhe Patil (BJP)   Dhule Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre (BJP)    Beed Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter Pritam (BJP); Bajrang Sonawane (NCP)   Sangli Sitting MP Sanjay Patil (BJP)    Mumbai North Central Poonam Mahajan (BJP)    Aurangabad Subhash Zambad (Congress)   Gadchiroli Ashok Nete (BJP)   Mumbai North Gopal Shetty (BJP)    Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

\u2018Will act against officials if disc.description: Madurai: Departmental action will be taken against officials if found guilty in connection with the alleged discriminatory practices prevailing against scheduled caste people in S Valayapatti village who were attacked by members of an intermediate caste, said the vice-chairman of National Commission for Scheduled Castes L Murugan. The NCSC team visited S Valayapatti village along with officials from revenue and police department including district collector (in-charge) S Shantha Kumar on Saturday. When asked whether the transfer of two anganwadi workers belonging to scheduled caste based on pressure from intermediate caste members did not amount to encouraging discrimination, the vice-chairman said that was why he had issued showcause notice to the officials concerned. He had asked them to explain why legal action should not be initiated under the scheduled caste and scheduled tribe (prevention of atrocities) act against those responsible for shunting the anganwadi workers out of the village, he said. Murugan visited the affected people and took stock of the property damaged in the attack that took place on Sunday night. He insisted that the officials carry out speedy investigation and disburse compensation. Four people from scheduled castes had sustained injuries in the attack, which was the culmination point of the caste tension that has been prevailing there for about two years. Police nab bike lifters, recover 3 stole.description: PUDUCHERRY: Police on Thursday arrested two motorcycle lifters and recovered three stolen motorcycles worth Rs 4.5 lakh from their possession. Police have launched a hunt for the prime accused in the crime. The arrested was identified as K Dheenadhayalan, 18 and K Nitish Kumar, 18 from Thanjavur district and the absconding as Aravind from Thanjavur. Superintendent of police (east) C Maran told reporters that M Thoufique Ahamed from Sulthanpet lodged a complaint that his Royal Enfield bike parked near Dupleix Statue on the Beach Road was stolen by unidentified persons on Wednesday. On the same day, two more people lodged complaints that their bikes parked in front of their houses were stolen. Police formed a special team under the direction of senior superintendent of police (law and order) Apoorva Gupta. The team members analysed the CCTV footages near the scenes of crime and ascertained that three youth were involved in the crime. The team members during an inspection spotted two youth riding the stolen Royal Enfield bike. They immediately intercepted them and on being questioned, the duo confessed to stealing the bikes in Puducherry. They also revealed the identity of the mastermind behind the crimes. Congress workers in Villupuram condemn r.description: VILLUPURAM: More than 100 workers of Congress on Sunday staged a protest at Nehruji road in Villupuram condemning the state highway department’s move to remove the statues of Rajiv Gandhi and Mahatma Gandhi for the expansion of Villupuram- Pondicherry highway. The cadres who raised slogans against the highways department also lodged a police complaint against the highways department assistant engineer for failing to send a prior notice to the Villupuram district Congress committee (DCC) about the removal of the statues erected by the Congress party. Police sources said the highway department has been evicting the roadside shops and has planned to remove the temples and statues that were disrupting the vehicular movement as part of the Villupuram – Puducherry highway expansion. A month ago, the Congress functionaries who had come to be aware of the highway department’s move had submitted a memorandum notifying the highway department and district administration to make an official notice while removing the statues of the erstwhile leaders that were been erected by the Congress party. According to Gulam Mohideen, former chairman of DCC, the state highway department especially the assistant engineer, Sridharan, who has some personal vengeance against the Congress party for staging a protest against the highway department for the recurring accidents, without even informing his senior officials had made arrangements to remove the Mahatma Gandhiand Rajiv Gandhi statues erected at Nehruji road here. The statues which were erected in 1970 and 1992 by congress leaders Kamraj and Muppanar respectively was been maintained by Villupuram municipality and had remained as an identity to the Villupuram town. Though the statues removal work was temporarily abandoned by the officials the protest had created a flutter at the Villupuram district headquarters. Photos: Puducherry Lt Governor Kiran Bed.description: PUDUCHERRY: Puducherry Lt Governor Kiran Bedi joined hundreds of devotees in pulling the chariot of Tirukameeswarar temple at a village near here on the occasion of the annual car festival Thursday. This morning...Temple CAR Festival, VILLIIANUR, along with Honble Minister, Namassivayam and others. https://t.co/1Jkzow4gle— Kiran Bedi (@thekiranbedi) 1560397086000Bedi pulled the chariot amidst chanting of hymns by devotees at the 12th century temple in Villianur. Chief Minister V Narayanaswamy, Ministers A Namassivayam and M Kandasamy, newly-elected Member of Parliament V Vaithilingam and legislators were among those who participated in the festival. The temple is among the ancient shrines in Puducherry and as per tradition, the Head of the State should drag the chariot on the occasion of the car festival. Pondicherry Universit library declared \.description: PUDUCHERRY: The Oxford University Press (OUP) has declared Ananda Rangapillai Library of Pondicherry University as the ‘library of the week’ acknowledging the special features of the library. The world’s largest university press has awarded a plaque to the Ananda Rangapillai Library recognizing its resources. It has also shared a special article about the library through @OUPLibraries twitter feed. OUP has been in the practice of undertaking research on libraries in India and south-east Asia and naming the ‘library of the week’ highlighting its special features, types of collections of books and the history of the library. Presently R. Samyuktha is the librarian of Pondicherry University. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP Candidate List.description: NEW DELHI: Amid rumblings over ticket denials in some seats like Kanpur, where saffron veteran   Murli Manohar Joshi has been benched   , and Bangalore South, where the wife of late party leader Ananth Kumar was overlooked for a young debutant, BJP issued on Tuesday a list of 43 nominees for the Lok Sabha polls. Not budging in the face of Joshi’s stiff resistance to being asked to step aside, BJP announced Satyadev Pachauri, a minister in the UP cabinet, as the replacement for the octogenarian leader. The list of 30 candidates for UP, however, accommodated women and child welfare minister Maneka Gandhi and her son Varun Gandhi, who were allowed to swap their Pilibhit and Sultanpur seats. Other interesting picks include   actor-politician Jaya Prada   , who was named against SP leader Azam Khan from Rampur in UP soon after she joined BJP. The selection ignites an old and bitter rivalry, as the former Bollywood star is close to former SP leader Amar Singh who has scores to settle with SP and Khan. Another UP cabinet minister, Rita Bahuguna Joshi, a former UP Congress chief who joined BJP, will contest from the prestigious constituency of Allahabad, where the sitting party MP, Shyama Charab Gupta, has left for SP and is contesting from Banda. She is the daughter of the late H N Bahuguna, a former UP chief minister and well-known Congress leader. Law minister Ravi Shankar Prasad, the party’s candidate from Patna Sahib, faced protests when he landed in Patna on Tuesday. The protesters claimed loyalty to BJP’s Rajya Sabha MP R K Sinha, who was later pulled up by the party while sources said the heckling was led by a person identified as an expelled BJP member. Varun Gandhi, who has had his ups and downs in BJP, was on the list of nominees and will stake his claim for Pilibhit, which has been a family bastion. Maneka Gandhi will be pitted in a triangular contest against SP-BSP alliance candidate Chandrabhanu Singh, alias Sonu Singh, a local politician with clout among Rajput voters who could have turned up the heat for Varun. Rajya Sabha MP Sanjay Singh is in the fray as the Congress nominee. Joshi, a former BJP president, made no secret of his displeasure at being denied a ticket and went public by releasing a letter addressed to voters of Kanpur saying he received a call from party general secretary (organisation) Ramlal asking him not to contest the polls. Joshi, 85, has been asked not to contest just as it was decided that 91-year-old party patriarch L K Advani will not fight from Gandhinagar. Joshi’s defiant note was possibly the reason behind the nomination of a Brahmin face as another UP state minister, Satish Mahana, had been talked of as the frontrunner to replace the veteran leader The party decision is in line with several veterans not being nominated to pave way for younger leaders. The 2019 election will see the curtain drop on the electoral politics of what was seen the Vajpayee-Advani era in the party. BJP has also not given tickets to B C Khanduri, Karia Munda, Kalraj Mishra, Bijoya Chakravarty — all MPs for several terms and over 80 years of age. BJP sprang a surprise by giving 28-year-old Tejaswi Surya, an advocate and Karnataka Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha general secretary, the ticket from Bangalore South, belying expectations that Tejaswini Ananth Kumar would be its choice for the constituency her husband represented six times. The choice triggered strong protests and even state BJP president B S Yeddyurappa said they had sent only Tejaswini’s name, which, he claimed, was changed in Delhi. Tejaswini had to issue statements to mollify her supporters as she said the polls were about re-electing Narendra Modi as Prime Minister. BJP has announced 349 candidates, including 62 in UP, so far. Two seats in UP have been left for alliance partner Apna Dal (Sonelal). Party president Amit Shah will decide the remaining 16 seats in UP where sitting MPs are likely to be replaced, and a reason behind delaying the announcement is to reduce prospects of dissidence and rebellion. The party has so far dropped 14 sitting MPs in UP. BJP general secretary Arun Singh announced that Union minister Manoj Sinha has been fielded from Ghazipur, a seat he had won in 2014. BJP’s Kisan Morcha chief Birendra Singh Mast has been shifted from his sitting seat Bhadohi to far-east Ballia in UP, replacing sitting MP Bharat Singh, whose poor performance was a concern for the party. Agra MP Ram Shankar Katheria, head of the SC commission who had been denied renomination from the current seat, has been moved to Etawah (SC), replacing Ashok Kumar Dohray. UP BJP president Mahendra Nath Pandey has been repeated from Chandauli. In Video:No Murli Manohar Joshi in BJP list of 43Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Jipmer doctors protest attack on Bengal.description: Puducherry: The Jipmer resident doctors’ association (Jipmer RDA) and Indian medical association’s medical students' network (IMA MSN) in the institute abstained from work at the operation theatres and outpatients’ department on Friday to register their protest on the attack on doctors at Kolkata by the family members of a deceased patient. The resident doctors and interns, however, treated the inpatients and attended emergency cases. They wore black ribbons and badges while on duty to express their solidarity with the nationwide strike and protest by RDAs and IMA MSNs in all colleges in the country. They also boycotted the academic activities on Friday. They staged a demonstration in front of emergency medical services condemning attack on the doctors and West Bengal government’s indifferent attitude towards the plight of the young doctors. They took out a rally to the administrative block and submitted a memorandum to Jipmer director Rakesh Aggarwal urging him to take appropriate initiatives to ensure the safety of the doctors in the institute. They also submitted a memorandum to lieutenant governor Kiran Bedi. They demanded central legislation for the protection of the doctors on duty. They urged the Jipmer administration to ensure posting of necessary graded police force at the outpost on the premises and posting of necessary police force preferably at the emergency medical service department. They insisted that the graded police force must take out regular shift-wise rounds. They also urged the administration to increase the strength of the security forces on the campus. A group of people, mostly the relatives of a deceased patient, attacked young duty doctors Paribaha Mukherjee and Yash Tekwanu at the NRS medical college and hospital at Kolkata on June 10. Narendra Modi.description: NEW DELHI: Urging the opposition to stop worrying about numbers, PM Modi on Monday said every word of the opposition was important and all efforts should be made for a " nishpaksh" (non-partisan) approach to issues of public welfare and the larger interest of India. His remarks at the start of the first session of the 17th Lok Sabha echo his announcement on Sunday of a meeting of leaders of all parties and an informal interaction of MPs, in what is seen as a bid to break the ice after a bitter poll campaign. "The opposition should stop worrying about numbers. The people have given them a certain number. Every word of the opposition is important. When it comes to Parliament, we should forget the ruling side and opposition. We should think of issues with a nishpaksh spirit," Modi said. The Prime Minister said an active and effective opposition is a necessity in a democracy and pointed out that a well- argued and factual criticism of the government strengthens democracy. "Sometimes such positive contributions are not noticed as they do not get high TRPs," he said. Though he did not mention the media, he said highlighting such efforts would strengthen the functioning of Parliament. Modi noted that the recent elections have yielded several firsts such as the highest number of voters exercising their franchise since Independence, a high number of women voters and a higher representation for women in Parliament. "It is also after several decades that a government has been re-elected with a bigger majority," he said. Referring to his recent speeches, the Prime Minister said that "we started with ' sab ka saath, sab ka vikas', but the people have added an unprecedented 'vishwas' (trust) to the matter". He said Monday marks the the start of the first session after the 2019 Lok Sabha polls. "I welcome all new MPs. With them comes new hope, new aspirations and new determination to serve," he said. In Video:Oppositions' every word is valuable: PM Narendra ModiDownload The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Former Puducherry chief minister RV Jana.description: PUDUCHERRY: Former Puducherry chief minister and DMK leader R V Janakiraman passed away in a private hospital here in the early hours of Monday after a prolonged illness. He was 78. Janakiraman’s body has been kept at his residence here for the public to pay homage. The last rites will be held in his native village -- Alathur -- in Villupuram district of Tamil Nadu at 10am on Tuesday. Puducherry chief minister V Narayanasamy, DMK president M K Stalin and a host of Congress and DMK leaders condoled the death of Janakiraman. Narayanasamy said the late chief minister would be laid to rest with state honours. Janakiraman’ had served as Puducherry chief minister between 1996 and 2000. He had been elected from Nellithope constituency for five consecutive terms (1985, 1990, 1991, 1996 and 2001). He lost the polls to AIADMK candidate Om Sakthi Sekar in 2006. Diagnosed with neurological ailments, Janakiraman had not been active in political sphere for the past few years. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Police nab vehicle lifters, recover stol.description: PUDUCHERRY: Police have bust a gang of vehicle lifters and arrested four here on Sunday. They also recovered four stolen vehicles – a Tempo Traveller and three Tata Ace – all worth approximately Rs 12 lakh from their possession. The arrested were identified as N Ramesh, 23, and S Ashok, 27, of Ariyankuppam, R Brabu, 36, of Gandhipuram, Coimbatore, and A Murganantham alias Vimal, 23, of Udumalaipet in Tirupur district. The four confessed to stealing pink-coloured Tempo Traveller and Tata Ace in Puducherry under D. Nagar police station limits and a gold-coloured Tata Ace in Virapandi in Theni district and another Tata Ace with tampered engine and chassis numbers also in Tamil Nadu. Superintendent of police (north) Chinta Kodandaram said S Perumal of Shanmugapuram lodged a complaint with the Mettuplayam police station stating that his Tempo Traveller parked near the Kalamkatha Mariyamman Koil, Pipdic Main Road, Mettupalayam, was stolen by unknown culprits. Kodandaram said police formed special teams under the direction of senior superintendent of police (law and order) Apoorva Gupta. The teams managed to trace and arrest four of the culprits and recovered the vehicles. Police also suspect the involvement of others in the crime and have laid a dragnet for them. Kodandaram said Ramesh and Ashok were involved in more than six cases of theft under Lawspet, D Nagar and Mudaliarpet police station limits. The SSP congratulated the SP and his team for cracking the cases. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Jipmer strike: No OPD, lab on Monday.description: PUDUCHERRY: The services at the outpatients’ department and laboratory in the Jawaharlal institute of postgraduate medical education and research (Jipmer) will be suspended on Monday as the Jipmer doctors’ association has served a strike notice to the administration. The elective surgeries scheduled on Monday will also be suspended due to the strike, according to a release from the institute. However, the institute will extend emergency medical services. The strike by the Jipmer doctors' association is to register their protest on the attack on duty doctors at a hospital in Kolkata. A group of people mostly the relatives of a deceased patient attacked young duty doctors Paribaha Mukherjee and Yash Tekwanu at the NRS medical college and hospital at Kolkata on June 10. The Jipmer resident doctors' association and Indian medical association's medical students' network staged a demonstration in front of emergency medical services on Friday to condemn the attack on the doctors. They also took out a rally to the administrative block and submitted a memorandum to Jipmer director Rakesh Aggarwal urging him to take appropriate initiatives to ensure the safety of the doctors in the institute. Special prayers and feast mark Eid in Ve.description: Vellore:‘Eid al-Fitr’, the festival that marks the end of the month of Ramadan or holy month of fasting was celebrated with religious fervour and distribution of food and savouries to friends and relatives across Vellore district on Tuesday . Thousands of Muslims who gathered at idgahs and mosques offered special prayers in the morning at various parts of the district .  In Vellore the Eid special prayers was organized at various idgahs near mosques at Kaspa , Saidapet , BTC mettu mosque , R N Palayam mosque , Sathuvachari , Konavattam , Tippu Sultan mosque at Arcot road and several other mosques .  At the end of the prayer the devotees hugged each others and exchanged Eid greetings.  As charity and helping the needy is an important part of the Ramzan festival celebration, muslims in the district donated food to the poor and destitutes living in charitable homes and orphanagesin the district . Burglars loot valuables worth Rs 10 lakh.description: VELLORE : Burglars who broke into as many as four houses at Vallalar in Vellore on Monday night decamped with gold jewels and cash worth Rs 10 lacs. A police officer said the gang broke into the house of former AIADMK MP Margabandhu’s son, Ezhilmaran, and stole 1 sovereign of gold jewels and Rs 2,000 in cash. The occupants were fast asleep at the terrace of the house at the time. They also stole Rs 20,000 in cash from Ezhilmaran’s brother Pugazhenthi’s house  Similarly about Rs 8 lakh worth valuables were reported looted from the house of a businessman, Janarthanan. Also Rs 1.5 lakh-worth gold jewels were looted from the house a doctor who lives in the same locality. “We suspect the same gang to be involved in all the four robberies and have launched a hunt for nabbing the accused“ said a police officer attached to Sathuvachari police station . Mamata Banerjee.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Projecting TDP supremo and AP chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu as a “national leader of importance” and keeping the debate on the alternate front prospects in the ensuing elections alive, West Bengal chief minister and Trinamool Congress chief Mamata Banerjee appealed to people of AP to elect TDP again to keep the duo of Narendra Modi and Amit Shah away from power. “Who is Modi to ask about our Prime Minister candidate? We will decide who to elect our leader as there will be alternative for Modi,” she pointed out. Mamata said Naidu has done a lot for development of Andhra Pradesh. “It’s a necessity for AP people to give the power to Naidu again as he will play a key role in national politics and show a path of development to the entire country,” she added. Addressing a public meeting convened by TDP on Sunday, Mamata said Naidu is the leader to take the country forward. “Like he has done in Andhra Pradesh, Naidu can do a lot in Delhi,” she said. Coming down heavily on Modi, Mamata appealed the gathering to save the country and remove Modi (desh ko bachana hai to Modi ko hatao). “Modi claimed to be chaiwala after 2014 elections. Now he says he is chowkidar,” she added. “But chowkidar for whom? For those who looted the country. Modi had claimed that demonitisation would mitigate terrorism and stop black money, but ironically the number of terrorist attacks was the highest in the past two years. Under Modi’s regime, more number of farmers committed suicide and unemployment increased.” She added that Modi failed to explain the Pulawama incident and the Rafale deal and spurned the demand for an all-party meeting on the issues. “The nation does not want leaders like Narendra Modi and Amit Shah,” she asserted, and challenged Modi for an open debate on a national channel of his choice to discuss issues facing the country. \u2018Get biometric attendance in govt o.description: Puducherry: Chief minister V Narayanasamy has directed the chief secretary Ashwani Kumar to initiate efforts for installing biometric attendance system in all government offices in the Union territory of Puducherry. Narayanasamy, who undertook a surprise inspection at the chief secretariat on Friday, noticed that a sizeable number of government servants did not reach office on time. Speaking to reporters he said the government servants have formed cartels among themselves to save latecomers claiming that they have sought permission earlier or have submitted leave letters. He said the government will initiate disciplinary action against government servants indulging in such practices and the latecomers. When the government servants go all-out to stage protests to establish their rights they must discharge their duty of serving the people, he said pointing out that inordinate delay in clearing the important files by them hampers the implementation of various schemes and projects of the government.  To a query on lieutenant governor Kiran Bedi’s reaction to his call for agitation as an attempt to provoke lawless behaviour, he questioned whether the chief minister did not have powers to hold a ‘peaceful’ protest. He claimed that the territorial officials have extended complete support to the government but Raj Nivas has been ‘returning the files’ posing several queries thereby delaying the implementation of several development projects in the territory. “Puducherry registered 11% growth as against national growth rate of 5.7%. The growth and development of Puducherry will be hampered if there are inordinate delays in getting approval for the projects,” he said. Narayanasamy said the government has been very keen on the growth of the territory and has evolved policies, schemes and projects to promote industries and tourism and to generate more revenue. “These schemes and projects must not be delayed, and the lieutenant governor must coordinate with the elected government for the growth of the territory,” he said. He pointed out that the recruitment of police constables and teachers and distribution of free rice were delayed by more than a year due to the interference of the lieutenant governor. Similarly, the government could not waive off farm loans due to Bedi’s interference. “We approached the Union home ministry and got approval for these schemes. We cannot be approaching the Union home ministry every now and then for every scheme or project. In the case between Delhi chief minister Kejriwal and lieutenant governor, the Supreme Court had declared that the lieutenant governor can refer only the rarest of the rare cases to the Union home ministry,” he claimed. AMMK Candidate List 2019.description: CHENNAI: AMMK deputy general secretary TTV Dhinakaran on Friday released the second and final list of candidates - 14 for the Lok Sabha polls and 9 for assembly bypoll in Tamil Nadu. The party has decided to field two of its heavyweight disqualified MLAs to contest Lok Sabha polls and to take on strong candidates from AIADMK alliance. Disqualified MLA from Andipatti and AMMK propaganda secretary, Thanga Tamilselvan, has been fielded from Theni Lok Sabha constituency, he will take on P Ravindranath Kumar, son of deputy chief minister and AIADMK coordinator O Paneerselvam. Disqualified MLA from Paapireddipatti and former minister P Palaniappan will be contesting the Lok Sabha polls from Dharmapuri constituency. He will take on PMK youth wing leader and former Union health minister Anbumani Ramadoss, who is contesting on behalf of the AIADMK-BJP-PMK alliance.| Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in Tamil NaduBesides these two, AMMK has also selected another disqualified MLA, NG Parthibhan from Sholingar assembly segment, to contest Arakonam Lok Sabha constituency. He will take on former Unions minister of state S Jagathrakshakan of the DMK - Congress alliance on the seat. AMMK had earlier released its first list of 24 candidates for Lok Sabha and 9 candidates for assembly bypoll in the state last Sunday. Dhinakaran will release the party's manifesto for the Lok Sabha polls later during the day. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Woman ganja peddler arrested in Ambur.description: VELLORE: The Ambur town police on Thursday arrested a woman and seized 1,100g of ganja from her house at Reddithoppu in Ambur town. A senior police officer said Saraswathi, 35, took to ganja-peddling a month ago. Her mother Valliammal, 64, had been into the illegal trade for long and sent to jail several times. Valliammal was arrested two months ago for selling ganja. She had since been lying low over age-related issues. Based on a secret information that many daily wagers and college students were getting addicted to smoking ganja at the town, a police team conducted a surprise raid at Valliammal house. However, the team found that instead of Valliammal, Saraswathi had been carrying out the illegal trade. Inspector Harikrishnan said, “We are stepping up action to completely weed out marijuana sales in the town. Recently, some youths caught red-handed smoking marijuana were detained at the police station for more than two hours. Those found possessing or smoking ganja would be remanded.”tnn Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BSP List 2019 UP.description: LUCKNOW: The BSP on Friday announced its first list of 11 candidates for the Lok Sabha elections 2019, fielding JD(S) turncoat Kunwar Danish Ali from Amroha. Ali, who was general secretary of the Janata Dal-Secular, quit the party and joined the Bahujan Samaj Party only last week. The BSP also declared Haji Fazulrahman its nominee from Saharanpur, Malook Nagar from Bijnore and Girish Chandra from Nagina, a party release said. Hazi Mohammad Yakoob has been fielded from Meerut, Satbeer Nagar from Gautam Buddh Nagar, Yogesh Verma from Bulandshahr, Ajit Baliyan from Aligarh, Manoj Kumar Soni from Agra, Rajveer Singh from Fatehpur Sikri and Ruchi Veera from Aonla. Mayawati's BSP is contesting 38 of the 80 Lok Sabha constituencies in Uttar Pradesh under the seat-sharing arrangement with Samajwadi Party and the Rashtriya Lok Dal. Nipah test results likely today.description: PUDUCHERRY: The 53-year-old resident of Cuddalore district, who was admitted to the Jawaharlal institute of postgraduate medical education and research (Jipmer) here with symptoms akin to that of Nipah infection on Sunday continued to be in a critical state on Thursday. Jipmer sent the samples of the patient to the National institute of virology (NIP) in Pune on Tuesday for testing. The test results are expected on Friday. Presently the male patient is on ventilator support at the isolation ward in the institute. He had been working in Guruvayur in Kerala where one person tested positive for Nipah infection. Meanwhile, the directorate of health and family welfare has made all necessary arrangements to prevent any outbreak of Nipah infection in the Union territory. It has deployed teams of (Indian Red Cross Society IRCS) volunteers at bus stands and railway stations to identify sick travellers from high-risk areas of Kerala viz., Thrissur, Kollam, Ernakulam and Idukki districts and admit them to the isolation facility at the government hospital for chest diseases (GHCD) where a dedicated team from Indira Gandhi medical college and research institute (IGMC & RI) will screen the patients for Nipah virus. The team will refer patients requiring intensive intervention to Jipmer, which will extend diagnostic support for lab confirmation of suspected cases with Nipah infection including logistic support to transport samples to NIP and receiving the test results. The IRCS volunteers have been advising homecare under isolation for sick travellers, who are not suspected of Nipah infection. The directorate also instructed all the private medical colleges to equip themselves with necessary facilities including isolation wards with beds exclusively to treat patients suspected with Nipah infection. It has identified the head of the department of medicine of the Indira Gandhi government general hospital and postgraduate institute as the nodal officer for Nipah. It has directed both government and private tertiary care hospitals to send daily notification of acute encephalitis syndrome (AES) cases to the integrated disease surveillance project (IDSP). The directorate earlier convened a meeting of the heads of the institutions and heads of the department of medicine from IGMC & RI, Rajiv Gandhi government women and children hospital and Jipmer to review the preparedness and prevention of outbreak of Nipah infection in Puducherry. Cuddalore man tests negative for nipah v.description: PUDUCHERRY: The 52-year-old resident of Cuddalore district, who was admitted at the Jawaharlal institute of postgraduate medical education and research (Jipmer) here with flu symptoms akin to that of nipah infection, tested negative for nipah virus. The National Institute of Virology (NIV), Pune, which tested the samples of the patient sent by Jipmer declared that the patient has not been infected with nipah virus. NIV’s microbiology department, which received the samples of serum, endotracheal aspirate, CSF and urine of the patient on June 13, tested them and declared that the patient tested negative for Nipah infection. The patient identified as Natarajan from Cuddalore district, who was working in Guruvayur in Kerala where a patient tested positive for nipah infection was admitted to Jipmer in a semiconscious state on Sunday. His condition continues to be in a critical state as on Friday. He is on ventilator support at the isolation ward in the institute. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Satta King 2019.description: NEW DELHI: Satta Matka is a form of gambling or lottery that had originated before the Independence of India.Originally, the game of Matka gambling involved betting on the opening and closing rates of cotton as transmitted to the Bombay Cotton Exchange from the New York Cotton Exchange, via teleprinters.The modern-day Matka gambling/ Satta King is based on random number selection and betting. The players participating in the Satta Matka game/ gambling are required to choose the right number for winning the game. The player who wins the game becomes Satta King and is rewarded financially. Two of the most famous Matka games are - Kalyan and Worli. The Kalyan Matka gambling was started by Kalyanji Bhagat, a farmer from Gujarat, in 1962 and it ran for all days of the week. Another Matka gambling, New Worli Matka, was started by the Rattan Khatri in 1964 with slight modifications to the rules of the game. Khatri’s Matka ran only five days a week, from Monday to Friday.The modern Matka business is centred around Maharashtra.Some of the terms used in the game and their meaning is given below:    Term Meaning   Matka Matka means earthen pot that were used to draw numbers   Single Any digit between 0 and 9   Jodi/Pair Any pair of two digits between 00 and 99    Patti/Panna Three digit number    Open result / close result Outcome of matka betting   Berij Berij is last digit of jodi's/pair's sum The Google 2018 trends data shows that 'satta' and 'matka' were the top searched words in the Madhya Pradesh state in the year 2018. As per the Google data, 'satta' was the 4th most searched word with a score of 36 and 'matka' came 6th with a score of 23.Any form of Satta Matka gambling is illegal in India.Disclaimer: This content is for reference purpose only and The Times of India claims no ownership of this content. The Times of India does not support or promote piracy in any manner.Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

MBBS admissions: Jipmer publishes list o.description: PUDUCHERRY: Jawaharlal Institute of Postgraduate Medical Education and Research (Jipmer) has published on its website (http://jipmer.edu.in/) the list of shortlisted candidates for admission into the MBBS programme in the 2019 season. The institute will hold the first counselling between June 26 and 28. It will hold counselling for the unreserved / persons with disability (including Puducherry candidates) on June 26, for Other Backward Class / Scheduled Castes / Scheduled Tribes candidates on June 27 and for unreserved, Other Backward Class, Scheduled Castes, Scheduled Tribes (Puducherry candidates) and non-resident Indians and overseas citizens of India on June 28. The candidates must report at the Jipmer academic centre at 8am on their allotted dates. The institute will not allow the change in counselling date for any candidates. Candidates under the persons with disability category must appear before the medical board at the Jipmer academic centre at 9am on June 25. The institute will permit the candidates to attend the counselling only after verification of biometric fingerprint, photo and certificate. All the applicants who have appeared for the entrance examination can download their individual rank letter from the institute’s website from June 12 (from 11am onwards). The institute will not send individual communication to the candidates. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lok Sabha Poll 2019.description: LUCKNOW: With electioneering for the 2019 Lok Sabha polls gaining steam in Uttar Pradesh, political leaders are increasingly resorting to personal attacks on their adversaries. If the maverick BJP MLA from Bairia, Surendra Singh hit the headlines for his remarks against BSP supremo Mayawati, Uttar Pradesh cabinet minister Shrikant Sharma hit a new low by making indecent comments on Congress chief Rahul Gandhi. The Bairia MLA had said Mayawati gets facials done and her hair coloured even though she is 60-years-old. He also reportedly made offensive remarks against UPA chairperson Sonia Gandhi and Haryanvi singer-dancer Sapna Chaudhary, evoking widespread criticism from political parties and social media users. A media agency quoted him as saying that both Sonia Gandhi and Sapna Chaudhary used to work as dancers. "Rahul's mother (Sonia Gandhi) was also in the same profession in Italy and his father made her his own. He (Rahul Gandhi) should also take the family tradition forward and make Sapna his own," the MLA said. The BJP legislator, who is known for his controversial statements, had earlier termed Rahul Gandhi and his sister Priyanka Gandhi Vadra "Ravana and Shurpanakha", and accused Mayawati of "murdering" a woman's dignity by joining hands with one-time arch rival Samajwadi Party. UP Power Minister Shrikant Sharma stirred up a hornet's nest with his tweet terming the Congress president a "coward and impotent". The comments triggered a war of words between the two parties as well as on social media platform. Firebrand Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath also finds mention in the list of leaders accused of making personal remarks against political rivals. He recently termed Congress candidate from Saharanpur, Imran Masood, the son-in-law of Jaish-e-Mohammed chief Azhar Masood. Addressing a rally in Saharanpur on Sunday, Adityanath said, "The son-in-law of Azhar Masood has entered the constituency and he speaks the language of the terror mastermind. "You people have to ensure that the person who speaks the language of Azhar Masood is defeated in the Lok Sabha elections," he said while seeking votes for BJP candidate from Saharanpur, Raghav Lakhanpal. Union minister and BJP MP Mahesh Sharma referred to Rahul Gandhi as 'Pappu' and his sister Priyanka Gandhi as 'Pappu ki Pappi' during a poll campaign in Gautam Buddh Nagar. Rahul Gandhi has often been mocked by the BJP and his opposition as 'Pappu', a colloquial sneer. "Pappu kehta hai main prime minister banunga Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu.. aur ab 'Pappu ki Pappi' bhi aa gayi hai. Wo Priyanka kya pehle hamare desh ki beti nahi thi kya, Congress ki beti nahi thi kya, aage nahi rahegi kya? kya naya leke aayi hai?" the minister told a crowd of his supporters on March 16. The quotes loosely translate to "Pappu says he wants to become prime minister. Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu ... and now 'Pappu's Pappi' has also arrived. Wasn't Priyanka already a daughter of this nation, a daughter of the Congress? And would she not remain so in future? What new has she brought in?" Priyanka Gandhi.description: RAE BARELI: In her scathing attack on BJP and Modi government, Congress general secretary Priyanka Gandhi said that Congress doesn't need any certificate from anyone to prove its nationalist feelings. "Ye brashtachar ki baat karnewale sabse bade brashta hain… kaam ki baat karte hain magar sabse bade nikamme hain… dharma ki baat karne wale sabse bada adharm kar rahe hain - dharm ka istemal kar rahe hain… saheedon ka istemal kar rahe hain - sirf rajinit ke liye (They are talking of acting against corruption but are corrupt themselves… they talk of work but are good for nothing… they talk of dharma (read duties) but indulge in adharma by defying its norms - they use religion and martyrs for political interests)," Priyanka stated in her closed door meeting with cadres on Thursday. The Congress leader hit out at BJP's strategy of playing the nationalist card. "We are Congress… we launched the freedom movement… gave our blood and sweat… braved British atrocities … we don't need any certificate to prove our nationalist feelings especially from the ones who apologised to the British at that time", asserted Priyanka, urging the workers to go to every household in their area and meet every voter. She directed the workers to apprise the voters that the 2019 Lok Sabha election was as important as the freedom movement. Infusing energy in them she said, "Don't be afraid of anything as this is a weak government. Only a weak government curbs the voice of the people, which is a crime in democracy." Priyanka asked the workers to stand up for their leader whose only dream is the progress of India and its people. "Rahul thinks of the people without any vested interest," Priyanka said citing the example of her conversation with Rahul on the issue of using self-help group women for campaigning. "When I proposed to him this idea, he simply denied… saying that I created the SHGs to empower women, not use them in any way," Priyanka said quoting her brother. The Congress general secretary told the workers that she was working on mission 2022. "We will, with your support, form the government in 2022. And once we come, we will stay here for long on the basis of our hard work," she said adding that the hard-workers would be adequately rewarded. Pawan Kalyan.description: GUNTUR: Stating that they will bulldoze bastions of TDP and YSR Congress, Janasena president Pawan Kalyan promised to grant Rs 5,000 pension to all farmers in the state. He said they will also grant Rs 8,000 crop incentive to farmers soon after coming into power in the next elections. Pawan further said his government would provide six to 10 LPG cylinders free-of-cost to each family every year. and also promised to fill 3 lakh vacancies in the government departments to provide jobs to youth. Addressing a meeting in Guntur on Monday, Pawan said that the future of the state did not mean the future of Lokesh and Jagan but it was the future of the people. “The space on the state’s political stage is not TDP’s and YSRC’s property as youth and women are eager to bring change through Jana Sena.” “TDP had lost moral right to rule the state as chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu had no control over his legislators who indulged in illegal activities,” Pawan said adding that he jumped into the political arena to bring in a change in the lives of commoners. “We supported TDP and BJP in the last elections with a hope to transform the state. Unfortunately, both of them have shattered our dreams,” he said. “Guntur city has been left in a lurch despite located a few kilometres away from the capital city. The entire city has been dug out in the guise of laying underground drainage scheme and left without repair. How shocking it is to see 30 people dying of diarrhoea in a city like Guntur? Is it not the failure of the state government? Opposition leader Jaganmohan Reddy is equally responsible for the tragedy as he never dared to question the government by going to the assembly,” he said. He further said they would construct apartments exclusively for Muslims in the city. He appealed to people to support his candidates Chandrasekhar (Guntur West), Zia-Ur-Rehman (East) and MP candidate Bonaboina Srinivas Yadav in the elections, Pawan said they fielded a BC candidate Srinivasa Yadav whereas TDP and YSRC both have given tickets to their own communities. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

CM: Be ready for agitation against Kiran.description: PUDUCHERRY: Chief minister V Narayanasamy claimed that lieutenant governor Kiran Bedi has not stopped posing hindrances to the elected government and appealed to cadres of the Congress party and its allies to prepare themselves for a struggle against her. Speaking at the death anniversary observation of former chief minister V Venkatasubba Reddiar at the party office on Thursday, Narayanasamy accused Bedi of stalling all development works, projects to promote tourism and industries and generate employment of the elected government in the last two and half years. He recalled that the government could implement the free rice scheme and other projects only after a six-day sit-in strike led by him, his cabinet leaders and leaders of its allies in front Raj Nivas in February this year. He went on to claim that the landslide victory of Congress’ candidate V Vaithilingam in the Lok Sabha polls reflected the people’s rejection of Bedi's interference in the day-to-day affairs of the elected government. “And still lieutenant governor has not changed her approach,” Narayanasamy said. Stating that the elected government derives the strength from the leaders and cadres of Congress party and its allies, he said the government has been compelled to take an alternative course of action if Bedi continues to stall the projects introduced by the government. He was of the strong opinion that a lieutenant government must assist the government in securing more funds for the Union territory from the Centre and act in coordination with the government. “Lieutenant governor must not undertake inspections and convene meetings with the territorial officials to review various schemes,” he claimed. The Madras high court on April 30 declared that the Puducherry lieutenant governor cannot run a parallel government and cannot interfere with the day-to-day affairs of the elected government. The Union government filed an appeal before the Supreme Court against the Madras high court order. A vacation bench of the Supreme Court comprising Justices Indu Malhotra and M R Shah directed the Puducherry government not to implement any decisions having financial implications until June 21. The Puducherry cabinet, which will convene on June 7, has proposed to accord approval to a slew of projects that were rejected by the Union home ministry. Most of the projects have been proposed in Yanam, the territory’s enclave in Andhra Pradesh. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Anantnag Encounter.description: SRINAGAR: An Army Major died while another officer of the same rank and two soldiers were injured in a gunfight at Bidoora village, in Achabal area of south Kashmir's Anantnag district, on Monday, a defence spokesman said. A Pakistani terrorist was killed in the encounter. Major Ketan Sharma of 19 Rashtriya Rifles, who died in the Achabal encounter, belonged to Meerut. A police officer said they had found the body of a Pakistani terrorist and seized arms and ammunition from the encounter site. The identity of the slain terrorist was being ascertained. In another attack, at least nine Army soldiers were injured in an IED blast that targeted a security vehicle of 44 RR at Aarihal village in Pulwama on Monday evening. Those injured in the Achabal gunfight and IED blast were rushed to the Army's 92 Base hospital in Srinagar, officials said. In the third attack in 24 hours, terrorists lobbed a grenade at the headquarters of the 180 CRPF battalion camp in Tral sub-district of Pulwama late on Monday evening. The grenade exploded outside the headquarters. No casualties have been reported. The first attack happened on Monday morning when a team of security men was on a cordon-and-search operation in Achabal. Terrorists fired at the team, who then retaliated. In the Pulwama attack, the terrorists after setting off the IED, opened fire at the Army vehicle. "Initial reports reveal the vehicle suffered extensive damage," the official said. Three of the soldiers injured in the blast were said to be serious, sources said. Soon after the attack, Army, police and SOG reinforcements were rushed to the spot and a massive search operation was launched. A defence spokesman, however, said some of the men sustained minor injuries in the IED blast. Damage was minimal due to the alertness of the patrol party, he said. The vehicle was an armoured ALS and not a Casspir (a mine-resistant, ambush-protected vehicle), he added. In Video:Indian Army’s vehicle attacked by IED in J&K’s PulwamaDownload The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Valuables worth Rs 3 lakh looted from ho.description: VELLORE: The Vaniyambadi police officials are on the lookout for a burglar who looted valuables worth Rs 3 lakh from the house of a hardware shop owner and attempted to loot a few more houses in the vicinity at New town area in Vaniyambadi on the wee hours of Friday. Police said that around 1 am, an unidentified miscreant broke into the house of the victim, Balaji, through the rear door. He allegedly looted Rs 3 lakh worth valuables including 1.5 kilograms of silver ornaments, a still camera, a mobile phone and a watch.  The burglar also attempted to loot three more houses including a private school correspondent’s house located in the same street as per the CCTV footage obtained but no valuables were found missing from these houses.  Based on a complaint by Balaji, police registered a case and are tracking the CCTV grab to nab the burglar.tnn Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Week-long celebrations to mark internati.description: PUDUCHERRY: The Centre for yoga therapy, education and research (Cyter), a unit of Sri Balaji Vidyapeeth (SBV), a deemed university will hold a series of events from June 13 to 21 to commemorate the international yoga day celebrations on June 20 as per the guidelines of the University grants’ commission and Ayurveda, Yoga and Naturopathy, Unani, Siddha and Homoeopathy (Ayush) ministry. Cyter director and professor (yoga therapy) Ananda Balayogi Bhavanani said the centre will hold yoga awareness campaign for the patients at the Mahatma Gandhi medical college and research institute, a constitute college of SBV on June 13, a national seminar cum workshop on ‘Divyanga yoga yogic approach to address the special needs at the university in association with Kaivalyadhama Yoga Institute, International centre for yoga education and research, Samagra Shiksha, Satya Special School, Indian Yoga Association and Pondicherry Yogasana Association on June 14 and 15. It will also hold an awareness programme for children with special needs on June 17, mental health and wellbeing through yoga for the children with special needs on June 18, and a regional-level yogasana competition for students of the institutions imparting professional health education on June 20. The celebrations will conclude with a mass yoga demonstration at the promenade of Puducherry beach on June 21. SBV vice-chancellor S C Parija said yoga acquires great relevance, as it epitomizes the country’s spiritual value, heritage and code of conduct. “Cyter is a vibrant centre spearheading all-out efforts propelled towards fostering yoga therapy in all the three avenues expected of health sciences higher education institutions namely academics, research and patient care,” said Parija. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Bedi refutes Narayanasamy\u2019s charges.description: PUDUCHERRY: Lieutenant governor Kiran Bedi refuted the charges levelled by chief minister V Narayanasamy terming them as a ‘set of half-truths and total lies’. The chief minister accused Bedi of stalling the elected government’s development works and schemes and projects to promote tourism and industries and to generate more revenue. Bedi said her office works for the interest of the people ‘in letter and spirit’ and ‘within the framework of law and rules. “Public money is sacred. And it’s because of careful (approach) we have been able to save Puducherry from a debt trap last year. On the contrary, we for the first time spent according to our budget and within borrowing limits,” she said while brushing aside the chief minister’s charges. “We keep the focus on our work. But that does not mean misinformation is not rebutted and countered,” she added. She appealed to one and all to join her in ‘Puducherry green mission’. “Team Raj Nivas every weekend shall continue going to the chosen/identified place with its own seeds and saplings, and gardening implements to sow seeds or plant trees. All those who choose to join in are requested to come along with their own seeds or saplings and gardening implements to join in the ‘Green Puducherry’ Mission,” she said. Raj Nivas, which focused on making Puducherry prosperous in 2016, focused on ‘Swatch Puducherry’ in 2017, ‘water-rich Puducherry’ in 2018, has embarked on a mission to transform Puducherry into a green territory in 2019. “Tomorrow (Sunday) we begin ‘Mission Green Puducherry’ with planting trees at Kanagan Lake at 6am on the invitation and in partnership with residents of the area,” she said. Earlier Kiran Bedi resumed weekend rounds on Saturday and visited Kangan Lake . Lieutenant governor Kiran Bedi, who will turn 70 years on Sunday will offer special prayers at the temple on Raj Nivas premises at 9am. The prayers will be followed by the release of a book titled, 'Where kindness spoke' authored by Shivani Arora. Chief secretary Ashwani Kumar will release the book. Raj Nivas will be thrown open to the people and government servants between 11am and 1pm to greet the lieutenant governor on her birthday. “I dedicate my 70th birthday to Puducherry. I commit to make all my future weekend rounds along with Team Raj Nivas towards the cause of ‘Mission Green Puducherry’ by planting trees on the banks of water bodies, such as tanks, lakes, ponds and more.,” she said in a WhatsApp message. Cops quiz bank staff after allegation of.description: Tiruvannamalai: A special team of police is conducting an inquiry with five employees, including two jewel appraisers, of a private bank from Tuesday after rumour spread fast that about 750 grams of gold jewels worth Rs 1 crore were allegedly misappropriated by the appraisers with the help of some employees. Police sources said a private bank (Karur Vysya Bank) has been functioning on Sannathi Street in Tiruvannamalai. On Monday, a customer who came out of the manager’s cabin, claimed that his gold jewels mortgaged with the bank were missing and the bank officials had misappropriated it by pledging it for a higher value in some other bank. Customers, who were shocked over the man’s allegations, started queueing in front of the bank to check whether their jewels are in safe hands. After Tiruvannamalai SP M R Cibi Chakravarthi was alerted about the incident, a special team of police are inquiring with the bank’s appraisers, including Mani and Karthi, and auditing the jewels in the safe with the help of bank manager Suresh. However, Suresh refuted the charge and claimed it was nothing but a rumour. He also refused to reveal details of the man who said his jewels were missing. “All the jewels are safe in the locker. Some customers, who were denied loan by the branch, are spreading unfounded rumours. However, scrutiny to cross-check the jewels kept in the locker is on with the help of Tiruvannamalai district police,” Suresh said. Speaking to TOI, Cibi Chakravarthi said, “So far in our inquiries there was no prima facie proof that such misappropriation had taken place in the bank. However, a team is conducting inquiries with five bank employees, including the manager. Further details can be revealed only after concluding the inquiry.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Encephalitis.description: Bihar is in the grip of Encephalitis. At least 108 children have lost their lives due to acute encephalitis syndrome (AES) in its Muzaffarpur district. AES accompanies flu-like symptoms such as high fever, headaches and convulsions. Japanese encephalitis virus (JEV) is the major cause of AES in India besides other sources such as bacteria, fungus, parasites, spirochetes, chemicals, toxins, and non infectious agents. Here's more. Fest to mark birth anniversary of Sankar.description: The department of art and culture and south zone cultural centre, Thanjavur will hold nine-day music. dance and theatre festival from June 14 to 22 at Gandhi Thidal on Beach Road to commemorate 152nd birth anniversary celebration of Sankaradas Swamigal, regarded as the father of Tamil theatre. Health minister Malladi Krishna Rao, who also holds the portfolio of art and culture, will inaugurate the festival in the presence of chief minister's parliamentary secretary K Lakshminarayanan at 6.30pm on June 14 at Gandhi Thidal on Beach Road. Lok Sabha Elections in Tamil Nadu.description: NEW DELHI: Tamil Nadu goes to polls in the second phase of the seven-phase elections. Elections to 39 parliamentary seats will take place on April 18 in a single-phase polling. Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesTOP CONTENDERSThe four-cornered contest features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). This time the elections are taking place sans the Dravidian stalwarts M Karunanidhi and J Jayalalithaa. AIADMK chief Jayalalithaa passed away in December 2016 while Karunanidhi died in August 2018. While the DMK is contesting on 20 seats, the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesHOW MANY SEATS?Tamil Nadu has 39 Lok Sabha seats and one in neighbouring Puducherry. Here is the list of constituencies: Arakkonam, Arani, Chennai Central, Chennai North, Chennai South, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Erode, Kallakurichi, Kancheepuram(SC), Kanyakumari, Karur, Krishnagiri, Madurai, Mayiladuthurai, Nagapattinam(SC), Namakkal Nilgiris(SC), Perambalur, Pollachi, Ramanathapuram, Salem, Sivaganga, Sriperumbudur, Tenkasi(SC), Thanjavur, Theni, Thiruvallur(SC), Thoothukudi, Tiruchirapalli, Tirunelveli, Tiruppur, Tiruvannamalai, Vellore, Villupuram(SC), Virudhunagar, Puducherry(Union Territory) KEY CONSTITUENCIESThe key constutuencies include Sivaganga, Chennai South, Chennai North, Chennai Central, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Kanyakumari, Karur, Thoothukudi , Nilgiris(SC), Trichy, Vellore amd Arani. Lateral entry list published by Centac.description: Puducherry: The Centralized admission committee (Centac) has published the provisional allotment list for lateral entry admission into diploma courses in polytechnic colleges for the residents of Union territory of Puducherry on its website www.centacpuducherry.in. The committee said the candidates can download their allotment orders from the dashboard using their login credentials from June 15. It directed them to join the respective colleges from June 17 to 20 (before 5pm). It also directed them to refer to the information brochure for fee details. There are 809 seats available for lateral entry admissions to diploma courses in six government polytechnic colleges in Puducherry, Karaikal, Mahe and Yanam. The committee received 418 applications for admissions and found 296 eligible candidates from Puducherry and 107 from other states eligible. It rejected the applications of 15 candidates. It allotted seats to 276 Puducherry candidates.tnn Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .
